0.title: Rohit Sharma tweets in Gujarati while praising Axar Patel for his match-winning knock
0.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma, who was rested for ODI series against West Indies, took to Twitter to praise Axar Patel and Team India for their victory against West Indies in the second ODI. He wrote, "Woah...that was some performance from Team India last night. Bapu...badhu saru che...(Everything is good)....Axar." Responding to him, Axar wrote, "Badhu saru che Rohit bhai...thanks...Cheers."

1.title: Assam Tourism Minister reviews flood situation in Barak Valley
1.article_body: Jayanta Mallabaruah, Assam's Tourism and PHED Minister, on Monday reviewed the flood situation in Barak Valley during his three-day visit there. During his visit, the minister also reviewed the relief measures being provided to the affected people. Additionally, he also instructed officials of the Water Resources Department to take necessary steps to avoid further flood-like situations.

2.title: Keeping option of coming out of retirement open for 1st women's IPL: Mithali
2.article_body: Ex-India Women captain Mithali Raj said she might consider coming out of retirement to play in the inaugural edition of women's IPL. "There are a few more months to go before the women's IPL happens. It would be lovely to be part of the first edition," she added. Mithali announced retirement from all formats of the game last month.

3.title: Unmarried Chinese woman seeking to freeze her eggs loses court case
3.article_body: An unmarried woman in China who sued a Beijing hospital in 2019, accusing it of refusing to freeze her eggs due to her marital status, has lost the case in court. The Chaoyang District People's Court in Beijing said in its judgement last week that hospital hadn't violated the woman's reproductive rights. The woman has planned to appeal the verdict.

4.title: Y Combinator-backed Better Opinions raises $2.5 mn in seed round
4.article_body: Event-based trading platform, backed by Y Combinator, Better Opinions has raised $2.5 million in its seed round. The round saw participation from investors, including Metaplanet VC and Goldwater Capital along with Y Combinator, Taurus VC, Original Capital, Tremis Capital, Super Capital, and other angel investors. The company has over 6,00,000 users who have traded over ₹10 crore on the platform.

5.title: India and Bangladesh discuss liberalisation of visa procedures
5.article_body: India and Bangladesh on Monday agreed for a more intensive implementation of provisions under the Revised Travel Arrangements of 2018 relating to tourist, student and business visas. During the third India-Bangladesh Consular dialogue held in Dhaka, both countries agreed for further liberalisation of visa procedures and entry and exit norms to enhance ease of travel.

6.title: Uttarakhand CM pays tribute to Indian Army on Kargil Vijay Diwas
6.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami paid tribute to the soldiers who laid down their lives for the country on Kargil Vijay Diwas. In his statement, Dhami said, "The whole world believes in the indomitable courage and valour of the Indian Army." Dhami added that the Indian Army has always raised the honour of the country.

7.title: Opposition is keeping political interests above country: PM Modi
7.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday accused the Opposition of obstructing development works, saying they keep their political interests above that of the country. He further said that the opposition parties couldn't implement decisions taken by them when they were in power. "Now if [decisions] are implemented, they oppose it. People of the country don't like it," PM Modi added.

8.title: Police arrest 6 criminals who were planning a murder in Jalandhar
8.article_body: Police have arrested six people with prior history of criminal offences with arms and ammunition in a raid in Jalandhar's Goraya district. Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP), Jalandhar Rural, Swarandeep Singh said that the accused were planning to kill a local sarpanch's nephew. A case has been registered under Section 115 of the Indian Penal Code.

9.title: Kanwariyas showered with flowers from helicopter by top UP officials; video surfaces
9.article_body: Senior officials showered flower petals on kanwariyas from a helicopter in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut on Monday. A video shows Inspector General Range Praveen Kumar and DM Deepak Meena showering the flowers on them. The Kanwar Yatra is being taken out after a gap of two years after it was suspended due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

10.title: Meghalaya BJP's Marak framed in prostitution case: State BJP chief
10.article_body: After a case was registered against Meghalaya BJP's state Vice-president Bernard N Marak for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Tura, the party's state President Ernest Mawrie asked that all charges be withdrawn, calling the case politically motivated. Condemning the raid, Mawrie requested the government to protect Marak's life. He added that Marak has been unjustly framed and maligned.

11.title: MP family performs last rites on road, claims no crematorium in village
11.article_body: Residents of Madhya Pradesh's Ajnaul village performed the last rites of a person in the middle of a road alleging that they have no crematorium in the village. Family members of the deceased said, "The incessant rains have filled our fields...We were left with no option." The villagers claimed that the families perform last rites in their own fields.

12.title: Centre devaluing Opp'n: Venugopal on Kharge's seat at President’s oath ceremony
12.article_body: Congress MP KC Venugopal stated that the way Centre treated Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge at the President's oath ceremony was not acceptable. "It is clearly devaluing the position of the Leader of Opposition," he added. Opposition parties wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman saying Kharge was made to sit in a seat "not commensurate with [his] position".

13.title: India spent ₹15,000 cr on roads near China border in 5 yrs: Centre
13.article_body: Centre told Rajya Sabha on Monday that India has spent ₹15,477 crore on construction of all-weather roads near the India-China border over the last five years. The BRO aims to complete 61 strategic roads assigned to it along the China border by end of this year, officials said. India and China recently held the 16th round of corps commander-level talks.

14.title: Want to be the first woman to play for India after having a baby: Cricketer Sneha Deepthi
14.article_body: Cricketer Sneha Deepthi, who made her India debut aged 16 years in 2013 and was later dropped, said she wants to be the first woman to play for India after having a baby. Sneha, who's now a mother-of-one, said, "That's how in India...things will change." The 25-year-old returned to domestic cricket in 2021-22, eight months after having a baby.

15.title: Europe returnee confirmed as Japan's first monkeypox case
15.article_body: Japan reported its first monkeypox case on Monday in the capital city of Tokyo. The city's Governor Yuriko Koike informed that a man with a travel history to Europe was found to be infected with the virus. The patient, in his 30s, is currently hospitalised, Koike said. WHO on Saturday declared the current monkeypox outbreak as a global health emergency.

16.title: Urged IOA to immediately arrange for accreditation of Lovlina's coach: Sports Ministry
16.article_body: The Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports has urged the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) to immediately arrange for the accreditation of the coach of boxer Lovlina Borgohain for Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. This comes after the Olympic bronze medallist tweeted that her coach is not being allowed to enter the CWG village and it is hampering her training.

17.title: Chinese Prez congratulates Murmu, says 'will work with her to handle differences'
17.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has congratulated the newly-elected President of India Droupadi Murmu and said that he's ready to work with her to "properly handle differences", reports said on Monday. Jinping said he will collaborate with Murmu to "push bilateral ties forward on the right track". He said he attaches "great importance to China-India relations", Chinese agency Xinhua reported.

18.title: Monkeypox transmission seems to be through physical contact: WHO official
18.article_body: WHO South-East Asia Regional Director Dr Poonam Singh has stated that the transmission of monkeypox appears to be occurring primarily through close physical contact including sexual contact. She said that transmission can also occur from contaminated materials such as linens, bedding, electronics and clothing that have infectious skin particles. India has reported four cases of monkeypox so far.

19.title: South Korea records 35,883 fresh COVID-19 cases
19.article_body: South Korea on Monday reported 35,883 fresh cases of COVID-19, taking its tally of total cases to 19,247,496, according to its health authorities. The country logged 65,433 new cases on the previous day. The decline in the daily caseload was due to lower testings over the weekend, Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency suggested.

20.title: Bus falls 40 metres into a river valley in Kenya, 34 reported dead
20.article_body: A bus in Kenya's Tharaka Nithi County veered off a bridge and fell 40 metres into a river valley killing 34 of its occupants on Sunday, local media reported. Speaking about the fatalities, an official said, "Up to now, we have lost 14 women, 18 men and two girls." The official added, "We have rescued 11 who are undergoing treatment."

21.title: Lionel Messi's chapter at Barcelona is not over: President Laporta
21.article_body: Barcelona President Joan Laporta said Lionel Messi's "chapter" at the club is "not over" and considers the club's responsibility to ensure the Argentine has a "more beautiful ending" at Camp Nou. "To Barca, he's been possibly its greatest player, the most efficient," he added. Messi left Barcelona for PSG last year when the club couldn't afford to renew his contract.

22.title: We need to stay alert, devoid of stigma: WHO Regional Director amid monkeypox
22.article_body: The Regional Director of World Health Organisation (WHO) South-East Asia Region Dr Poonam K Singh has stated that we need to stay alert and be prepared to roll out an intense response to curtail the spread of monkeypox. She further said that while doing this, our efforts and measures should be sensitive and devoid of stigma and discrimination.

23.title: European Union approves smallpox vaccine for use against monkeypox
23.article_body: The European Commission has approved the use of Bavarian Nordic's Imvanex vaccine for the treatment of monkeypox. This comes after the European Medicines Agency (EMA) recommended the use of the vaccine to treat monkeypox, which had been previously approved to only treat smallpox in the EU. The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared the monkeypox outbreak a global health emergency.

24.title: Bolsonaro launches election campaign for 2nd term as Brazil Prez
24.article_body: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro on Sunday officially launched his election campaign for a second term as the country's leader. Bolsonaro was nominated as the presidential candidate of the right-wing Liberal Party in the presence of around 10,000 supporters. Survey shows Bolsonaro trailing behind leftist leader Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in the October 2 first-round vote.

25.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz becomes youngest men's tennis player since Nadal to enter top 5
25.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz, a 19-year-old Spanish tennis player, has become the youngest to reach the top five of the men's world rankings since Rafael Nadal. Alcaraz entered the top five at the age of 19 years, 2 months and 20 days. Nadal had entered the top five on May 9, 2005, aged 18 years, 11 months and 6 days.

26.title: 3 dead, 15 hospitalised due to food poisoning in Rajasthan ashram
26.article_body: Three people died and around 15 were hospitalised over suspected food poisoning at the Apna Ghar Ashram in Rajasthan's Kota, officials said. The incident came to light after some people started vomiting while some others did not wake up on Monday morning. District Collector Om Prakash Bunkar has said that food and water samples are being collected for investigations.

27.title: Be more sensitive to differently-abled, rape survivors: Allahabad HC judges
27.article_body: Allahabad High Court judges said that Uttar Pradesh District Court judges should be more sensitive towards differently-abled and rape survivors. This was said as part of a conference on 'Sensitisation of District Court Judges on Gender Justice and Differently-Abled Victims/Survivors of Sexual Abuse'. Constitution does not make a revolution but it is revolutions that make a Constitution, they said.

28.title: Once I retire, I plan to catch up with all the alcohol I missed out on: Ruud
28.article_body: Following his ninth title in Gstaad, world number six Casper Ruud said there's not too much time to celebrate. "But I always told myself that whenever, some day, my career is done, I can catch up with all the alcohol I've been missing, for 17-18 years," he jokingly added. "I don't really drink too much alcohol," Ruud further said.

29.title: Ex-Meta employees raise $150 mn for their crypto venture Aptos Labs
29.article_body: Aptos Labs, a startup co-founded by ex-Meta employees Mo Shaikh and Avery Ching who worked on Meta's crypto project, has raised $150 million in new funding, Aptos announced. The funding round more than doubled Aptos' previous valuation, which was over $1 billion in March 2022. Founded less than a year ago, Aptos raised $200 million in its last funding round.

30.title: India issues statement after civilians killed in Iraq in alleged Turkish air raids
30.article_body: India has "strongly condemned" the recent killing of eight civilians, including two children, in northern Iraq in alleged air raids by Turkey on July 20. In a statement issued by Ministry of External Affairs, India said the killing "is a clear violation of [Iraq's] sovereignty and a blatant disregard for international humanitarian law". Turkey has denied responsibility for the attack.

31.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
31.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states. The IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall over Himachal Pradesh, Assam, Uttarakhand and Arunachal Pradesh on July 28 and 29. It also stated that fairly widespread light to moderate rainfall is likely over Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana across the next four days.

32.title: Told Ranbir I'll be upset if I don't produce his directorial debut: Alia
32.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who has produced her upcoming film 'Darlings', has said that she has discussed producing a film directed by her husband actor Ranbir Kapoor. "I actually told him that if you don't make me produce it, I'll be very upset!" she said. In an earlier interview, Ranbir had said that he wrote a story during the lockdown.

33.title: Can't tolerate the question: Alia on question about Ranveer being trolled for posing nude
33.article_body: On being asked about her reaction on actor Ranveer Singh getting trolled for his nude photoshoot, Alia Bhatt said, "I can't tolerate the question." Ranveer was recently trolled by a section of social media users over his nude photoshoot for Paper magazine. Calling Ranveer her favourite, Alia said that she doesn't like anything negative being said about him.

34.title: I have faced criticism due to my dusky skin tone: Ruchira Singh
34.article_body: Actress Ruchira Singh has revealed that she has faced criticism due to her dusky skin tone. The actress further said that her journey to showbiz was full of hardships. "I gave hundreds of auditions and got rejected many times, but I feel...one should be ready to face this if they wish to make it big in the industry," she added.

35.title: ₹14,820 cr tax demand raised under black money law on foreign income
35.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said the Centre has raised a tax demand of ₹14,820 crore after completing assessment in 368 cases under the black money law dealing with undisclosed foreign income. Sitharaman said 648 disclosures involving undisclosed foreign assets worth ₹4,164 crore were made in the one-time three months compliance window. The window had closed in September 2015.

36.title: Govt trying to intimidate us by suspending our MPs: Congress
36.article_body: Congress on Monday said that the government was trying to "intimidate" it and asserted that the party will not be cowed down. The remark came after Manickam Tagore, TN Prathapan, Jothimani and Ramya Haridas were suspended from the Lok Sabha for displaying placards raising the issues of rising prices of gas cylinders and imposition of GST on essential items.

37.title: Musetti wastes 5 championship points before winning 1st ATP title in Hamburg
37.article_body: Italy's 20-year-old Lorenzo Musetti wasted five championship points in second set of Hamburg European Open final before defeating top seed Carlos Alcaraz 6-4, 6-7(6-8), 6-4 to win his maiden title on Sunday. "For me, it's a dream. Obviously, I always dreamed about winning a title and I didn't have any chances before," said Musetti. It was Musetti's first tour-level final.

38.title: BJP can't break TMC by using central agencies: Mamata on Partha's arrest
38.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said BJP can't break Trinamool Congress (TMC) with the help of central agencies. Commenting on the arrest of West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, Banerjee said, "If anyone is found guilty, he/she must be punished. But I condemn the malicious campaign against me." She added, "Truth must come out but within a time frame."

39.title: Article 370 was a psychological barrier in India's integration: BJP
39.article_body: National President of BJP Yuva Morcha Tejasvi Surya on Monday said that Article 370 was a cultural and psychological barrier to India's integration. Kashmir is done with terrorism and is on the path of development after the abrogation of Article 370, Surya said. "When Article 370 was there, the youths of Kashmir were bereft of any opportunities," he said.

40.title: Sri Lankan court imposes overseas travel ban on 6 anti-govt protesters
40.article_body: A Sri Lankan court on Monday imposed an overseas travel ban on six protesters who were leading anti-government agitations amid economic crisis. The protesters have been part of an anti-government protest movement since April, which led to the removal of the Rajapaksas from all political positions. They were charged with unlawful gathering in June and granted bail after their arrest.

41.title: Confident on England's senior players covering Stokes' loss in ODIs: Buttler
41.article_body: Jos Buttler said he's confident that England's senior players will step up as the ODI team look to cover for the loss of all-rounder Ben Stokes following his retirement from the format. Buttler is still waiting for his first series win as permanent white-ball captain after he replaced Eoin Morgan as skipper following his retirement from international cricket in June.

42.title: Will keep IAEA cameras off till 2015 nuclear deal's revival: Iran
42.article_body: Iran on Monday said that it will keep the cameras installed by UN's atomic watchdog IAEA switched off until the revival of the 2015 nuclear deal, local media reported. Earlier in June, Tehran had informed IAEA about the removal of 27 cameras from Iran's nuclear facilities installed under the deal. Tehran's move came after IAEA passed a resolution criticising Iran.

43.title: I don't support corruption: Bengal CM Mamata after minister Partha's arrest
43.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said she doesn't support corruption, two days after state minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested by ED in connection with a teacher recruitment scam. "If someone has been involved in wrong activities, none of us will interfere no matter how harsh a verdict they face," she said. Mamata added, "We won't support them."

44.title: Woman thrashes Odia actress Prakruti over alleged affair with her husband, video surfaces
44.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a woman thrashing National Award-winning Odia actress Prakruti Mishra on a street in Bhubaneswar over an alleged affair with her actor-husband Babushaan Mohanty. In the video, the woman can be seen assaulting her husband and Prakruti after seeing them together in a car. The woman can be seen pulling Prakruti's hair in the car.

45.title: Taiwan conducts air raid exercise amid tensions with China
45.article_body: Taiwan on Monday ordered its residents to stay indoors as the country held an air raid exercise amid its ongoing tensions with China. Sirens were sounded off in the afternoon for street evacuation drills in cities and a 'missile alert' message was also sent to residents. China recently warned US of consequences if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan.

46.title: Centre collected ₹7 lakh cr as net taxes in Apr-Jun quarter, up 24% YoY
46.article_body: The Centre's net tax collections in the April-June 2022 quarter were nearly ₹7 lakh crore, up 24% YoY, as per data given by the government in the Lok Sabha. While ₹3.44 lakh crore was collected as indirect tax, ₹3.55 lakh crore was collected as direct tax. The Centre had set ₹19.35 lakh crore as FY23's net tax collection target.

47.title: Axis Bank's net profit nearly doubles to ₹4,125 crore in Q1 FY23
47.article_body: Axis Bank on Monday said its net profit rose 91% YoY from ₹2,160 crore in Q1 FY22 to ₹4,125 crore in Q1 FY23. The bank's net interest income in the April-June quarter grew 21% YoY to ₹9,384 crore while its non-performing assets declined to 2.76% from 3.85% in Q1 FY22. Its core operating profit grew 17% YoY to ₹6,554 crore.

48.title: Home cooking services platform ChefKart raises $2 mn in seed round
48.article_body: ChefKart, a Gurugram-based home cooking services platform, has raised $2 million in a seed funding round. Led by Pravega Ventures and Blume Ventures, the round saw participation from Zomato's Deepinder Goyal, Titan Capital, Cred's Kunal Shah, Tremis Capital, LetsVenture, among others. Founded in 2020, the company aims to solve the problem of the lack of reliable at-home cooking services.

49.title: US-based real estate developer Panattoni to invest $200 mn in India
49.article_body: US-based industrial real estate developer Panattoni will invest $200 million in India to develop four industrial and logistics parks across major cities. The Indian venture, headquartered in Bengaluru, is in talks with land owners to purchase around 250 acres of land in Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Chennai, Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Pune. The proposed investments include land, construction and other costs.

50.title: IIT-B graduates' content sharing app SuperShare raises $6.5 mn
50.article_body: SuperShare, a content sharing app, has raised $6.5 million from Lachy Groom, Accel India, and Lightspeed in its first funding round. The app, founded by Sagar Modi, an IIT-Bombay graduate, and Advaith Vishwanath, who was a part of Accel's investment team, is currently operating in stealth mode. Content creator Tanmay Bhat, MythPat, among others participated in the funding round.

51.title: Ranveer's nude photoshoot 'hurt women's sentiments', says police complaint
51.article_body: A police complaint has been filed against Ranveer Singh for allegedly "hurting sentiments of women" and 'insulting their modesty' through his nude photoshoot for Paper magazine, an official said. The complaint filed in Mumbai by an NGO office-bearer said, "This act...created shame in the eyes of the women at large." It said that such acts must be "opposed strongly".

52.title: Facing mental harassment ahead of CWG, can't understand how I can focus: Lovlina
52.article_body: Olympic bronze medal-winning Indian boxer Lovlina Borgohain took to Twitter to share she is facing mental harassment ahead of CWG 2022. She stated her coach is not being allowed to enter the Games village in Birmingham, adding that her training has been hampered eight days before her event. She further said she can't understand how she can focus.

53.title: I'll meet gracefully: Kartik on seeing an ex-girlfriend at an award show
53.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, on being asked about something he would never do in a relationship, said he would not "bad mouth and spread rumours". He was further asked how he would react upon meeting an ex-girlfriend at an award show to which the actor responded, "Meet her gracefully." Kartik and Sara Ali Khan dated while shooting 'Love Aaj Kal 2'.

54.title: Medical students walk out amid anti-abortion speech at US university
54.article_body: Dozens of students of the University of Michigan Medical School staged a walkout during a doctor's keynote address on anti-abortion views. The incident took place during the induction ceremony of the university's new students, a video of which has surfaced online. Last month, the US Supreme Court overturned the landmark Roe vs Wade ruling, which made abortion a constitutional right.

55.title: Stano edges Kawano by 1 second to win men's 35km race walk worlds gold
55.article_body: Italy's Massimo Stano won men's 35km race walk at World Athletics Championships on Sunday in a championship record time of 2:23:14, edging Japan's Masatora Kawano by one second. Stano and Kawano battled shoulder-to-shoulder as the leading pair in final 4km but Stano accelerated in final 300m to win the gold medal. Sweden's Perseus Karlstrom won the bronze (2:23:44).

56.title: Harman Baweja, wife Sasha Ramchandani expecting first child: Report
56.article_body: Actor Harman Baweja and his wife Sasha Ramchandani are expecting their first child together, reported Pinkvilla. Quoting a source, the report stated that Sasha is four months pregnant and the baby is expected to arrive in December. The couple got engaged in December 2020 and had an intimate wedding ceremony following Sikh rituals in Kolkata on March 21, 2021.

57.title: 2 smuggle 3,500 litres of foreign liquor in milk van, arrested
57.article_body: Kerala Police on Monday seized over 3,500 litres of Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL), which was being smuggled from Mahe in a milk van and arrested two people. "We found IMFL of various brands worth around ₹50 lakh. It seems like the duo was planning to sell this in Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam regions," police said.

58.title: Government issues high severity warning for some Apple Watch users
58.article_body: The government has issued a high severity warning for users of the Apple Watch with Operating System versions older than 8.7. The vulnerabilities could let attackers execute arbitrary code and bypass security restrictions on any targeted system, the Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) said. The government suggested applying patches in Apple security updates.

59.title: Traffic snarls likely in central, east, northeast Delhi on Tuesday
59.article_body: Major roads in parts of central, east and northeast Delhi and its bordering areas may face traffic snarls on Tuesday as kanwariyas would pass through the national capital, police said. A total of 1,925 police personnel and over 56 cranes and motorcycles have been deployed on their routes. Kanwariyas are expected to return through Apsara Border, Shahdara flyover and Seelampur.

60.title: Son kills 75-yr-old father over property dispute in Hyd restaurant
60.article_body: A 75-year-old man was allegedly killed by his son with a sickle inside a restaurant in Hyderabad over a property dispute. The deceased asked for ₹25 lakh from his son after he sold two plots of land without his knowledge. The accused was supposed to give the money on Sunday morning, but he allegedly killed the victim.

61.title: Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher-starrer 'Uunchai' gets release date
61.article_body: The producers of 'Uunchai' which features Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher, Boman Irani and Danny Denzongpa have announced that the film will release on November 11. The film also stars Neena Gupta, Sarika, Nafisa Ali Sodhi and Parineeti Chopra. 'Uunchai' marks director Sooraj Barjatya's return to filmmaking after seven years following Salman Khan-starrer 2015 film 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo'.

62.title: Prez Murmu's dreams, BJP's policies unlikely to go together: CPI MP
62.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam on Monday applauded Droupadi Murmu's acceptance speech after taking oath as the country's President but said her dreams and the BJP government's policies are unlikely to go together. In her speech, President Murmu said the country's deprived, poor, Dalits and tribals can see their reflection in her, which is a matter of big satisfaction for her.

63.title: PWD to soon begin repairing Mayapuri flyover on Delhi's Ring Road
63.article_body: PWD will soon begin repair work on the Mayapuri flyover on Delhi's Ring Road as the department has floated a tender for the same, officials said on Monday. The work will include replacement of the flyover's expansion joints and bearings and repairing of "spalled and honeycomb concrete". The maintenance work is likely to lead to traffic snarls during peak hours.

64.title: Video shows BJP leader drunk at Murmu’s victory celebration in dry Gujarat; he resigns
64.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows BJP district chief, Rashmikant Vasava, drunk at an event celebrating President Droupadi Murmu's election victory in dry Gujarat's Chhotaudepur. Vasava has tendered his resignation from the post. The video shows two BJP workers helping Vasava to walk at the event. He was also seen sleeping on the stage.

65.title: Mayer wins 2nd decathlon worlds gold after being at 6th spot overnight
65.article_body: World record holder Kevin Mayer won his second decathlon gold medal at World Athletics Championships on Sunday, benefitting from the withdrawal through injury of Olympic champion Damian Warner. The Frenchman was sixth overnight but won the pole vault and javelin, while his 10th-placed finish in 1,500 metres, the final event, gave him a score of 8,816 points and the title.

66.title: Techie, university student cheated of ₹7.91 lakh in Hyderabad
66.article_body: Hyderabad's Cyberabad Cybercrime Police has received two separate cyber fraud complaints where a university student and an IT professional were cheated of a combined ₹7.91 lakh on the pretext of part-time jobs. The IT professional was cheated of ₹5.75 lakh via a WhatsApp link. On the other hand, the student was duped of ₹2.16 lakh over a period of time.

67.title: B'luru metro to hold trial runs on Purple Line extension from Sept
67.article_body: Trial runs on the Bengaluru Metro's Purple Line extension from Baiyappanahalli to Whitefield will begin in September, senior officials said. "We are planning for completion by December, let us see," BMRCL Managing Director Anjum Parvez said. The Baiyappanahalli-Whitefield stretch will have stops at Mahadevapura, Garudacharpalya and Hoodi Junction among other places.

68.title: 300 saplings planted in President Droupadi Murmu's school to celebrate oath-taking
68.article_body: 300 saplings including Ashoka, Deodar and Aamla were planted in President Droupadi Murmu's Uparbeda upper primary school where she studied from Class I to Class VII. This was done to celebrate her taking the oath as India's first tribal woman President. The first sapling was planted by Bisweswar Mahanta who was headmaster during Murmu's student days.

69.title: Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts from July 25 to July 28
69.article_body: Several parts of Bengaluru will witness scheduled power cuts starting from around 10 am daily between July 25 to July 28 due to maintenance works, the city's power distribution company BESCOM informed. In East zone, areas including Ramaiah Layout, Ajmallappa Layout and CMR Road will experience the outages. In West zone, Kodipalya, Annapoorneshwari Layout and other areas will be affected.

70.title: BBMP issues notice barring garbage trucks from displaying its name
70.article_body: Bengaluru's civic body BBMP on Saturday issued a notice prohibiting contractors from displaying its name on garbage collection vehicles. Stating the reason behind the move, an official said that BBMP gets unfairly blamed when drivers of such vehicles cause accidents. Accidents involving contractual waste collection vehicles will result in criminal cases against the drivers, BBMP said.

71.title: Man rapes Taiwan national on pretext of marriage in Gurugram, held
71.article_body: A 29-year-old man has been arrested for repeatedly raping a 53-year-old Taiwan national on the pretext of marriage, police said on Monday. The woman, in her complaint, said that she met the accused six months back, after which she fell in love with him. She alleged he began taking sexual advantage of her and later blocked her number.

72.title: Your leadership gives new impetus to our ties: SL Prez to Prez Murmu
72.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe congratulated his counterpart Droupadi Murmu, who assumed charge as India's 15th President, on Monday. "Your leadership offers fresh impetus to our joint endeavours to nurture and strengthen the cordial ties we enjoy," he wrote in his message. Wickremesinghe was sworn in as Sri Lanka's 21st President last week amid the country's economic crisis.

73.title: Man attacked, killed with paver block while sleeping at bus stop in Mumbai
73.article_body: A 25-year-old man was attacked and killed with a paver block while he was sleeping at a bus stop in Mumbai's Versova, police said on Monday. The body of the victim, Suraj Manoj Tiwari, was found with multiple head wounds by passersby on Sunday morning. Investigation revealed that Tiwari hailed from Delhi's Palam and was a street musician.

74.title: Man who threatened Katrina is a struggling actor, wanted to marry her: Reports
74.article_body: The man who threatened the life of actress Katrina Kaif is a struggling actor who wanted to marry her, reports said on Monday. As per reports, the man is named Manvinder Singh alias Aditya Rajput and he is a fan of the actress. He has been arrested by Mumbai Police for threatening and stalking Kaif.

75.title: It was probably the best I've ever seen him bat: Parthiv on Axar's 64* vs WI
75.article_body: Commenting on India all-rounder Axar Patel's match-winning 64*(35) in his side's two-wicket win against West Indies in second ODI, Parthiv Patel said, "It was probably the best I've ever seen him bat." He added, "When Axar came out to bat, the game was going towards...West Indies. I've seen him very, very closely." Axar was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

76.title: Police helps reunite missing boy with parents in Hyd's Habeebnagar
76.article_body: A Blue Colts quick response team of Habeebnagar Police Station in Hyderabad on Sunday tracked down the parents of a missing child they spotted while patrolling the area, SHO Habeebnagar tweeted. The boy was then handed over to his parents, the official added. According to the SHO, the child was unable to disclose his parents' whereabouts.

77.title: Farhan Akhtar shares edited pic of himself with his great-grandfather Muztar Khairabadi
77.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar took to Instagram to share an edited picture of himself with his great-grandfather, late Urdu poet Muztar Khairabadi. "My family thinks I look like my great-grandfather, Muztar Khairabadi...what do you think?" Farhan wrote. "Absolutely," a fan commented on his post. "The resemblance is definitely uncanny," another fan wrote.

78.title: A lot of times I wonder if I should give up politics, there is more to life: Gadkari
78.article_body: While attending an event to honour social worker Girish Gandhi in Nagpur, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "A lot of times I wonder whether I should give up politics. There is more to life than politics." He added, "Today what we're seeing is 100% about coming to power...Is politics for the welfare of the society or about being in government?"

79.title: Regularisation law doesn't grant license for illegal construction: Bombay HC
79.article_body: Bombay High Court on Monday told Union Minister Narayan Rane that laws permitting regularisation of illegal portions of a residential structure don't give license to a person for illegal construction. The HC further asked BMC to file an affidavit explaining on which legal grounds it can consider a second application by Rane for regularisation of portions of his Juhu bungalow.

80.title: Will be tough on China, it's our number 1 threat: UK PM hopeful Sunak
80.article_body: Ex-British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Sunday vowed to be tough on China if elected as UK's next PM, calling China "number one threat" to domestic and global security. Sunak, who's one of the two final contenders for PM's post, proposed using UK's spy agency to combat Chinese espionage. He also proposed the closure of all Confucius Institutes in Britain.

81.title: US women win their 3rd straight 4x400m relay gold at World Championships
81.article_body: US won their third successive women's 4x400 metres relay gold medal at World Athletics Championships in Oregon, clocking world leading time of 3:17.79 on Sunday. Jamaica finished far behind US in 3:20.74 to win silver, while Britain clinched the bronze in 3:22.64. US finished at the top of the table with 13 gold, nine silver and 11 bronze medals.

82.title: Why should public bear brunt of Bundelkhand Expressway's defects: Akhilesh
82.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has criticised the BJP after a few accidents allegedly due to the potholes on the Bundelkhand Expressway in Uttar Pradesh. "Why should the public bear the brunt of the defects...of the Bundelkhand Expressway?... The hurriedness that the BJP had shown to inaugurate it, portions of the expressway got uprooted with [even] greater pace," Akhilesh tweeted.

83.title: MP woman inflicts burns on 9-yr-old adopted daughter for wetting bed
83.article_body: A woman allegedly inflicted burns on the private parts of her nine-year-old adopted daughter as punishment for wetting her bed in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, police said. Some hair on the girl's head had been uprooted and there were nail injury marks on her body, said Child Welfare Committee President Pallavi Porwal. An offence has been registered against the 40-year-old woman.

84.title: Jailed Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee doesn't need hospitalisation: AIIMS
84.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a teacher recruitment scam, has chronic health issues but he does not require hospitalisation, the AIIMS Bhubaneswar said. ED took Chatterjee to Bhubaneswar through air ambulance on Monday after he complained of uneasiness. He was earlier admitted to the SSKM Hospital in Kolkata.

85.title: Film composer Ilaiyaraaja takes oath as Rajya Sabha MP
85.article_body: Film composer Ilaiyaraaja took oath as a Rajya Sabha member on Monday. Ilaiyaraaja, along with legendary athlete PT Usha and filmmaker V Vijayendra Prasad, was nominated to the Rajya Sabha earlier this month. He took oath after Droupadi Murmu was sworn in as the 15th President of India at the Central Hall of Parliament House.

86.title: Kovind fulfilled BJP's political agenda as Prez: Mehbooba Mufti
86.article_body: PDP president Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said former President Ram Nath Kovind has left behind a legacy during which the country's Constitution was "trampled upon". "Be it scrapping of Article 370, CAA or the unabashed targeting of minorities and Dalits, he (former President Kovind) fulfilled BJP's political agenda at the cost of the Indian Constitution," she said.

87.title: I've got plenty of fuel left in tank: Hamilton after his 300th F1 race
87.article_body: Seven-time Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton said he "has plenty of fuel left in tank" to continue racing after becoming only the sixth driver in sport's history to complete 300 races on Sunday at French Grand Prix. The 37-year-old Mercedes' driver finished second at Le Castellet, his best result of 2022. Hamilton made his F1 debut in 2007 in Melbourne.

88.title: MP man gets 59-yr-old father murdered after hiring killer from FB
88.article_body: A man from MP allegedly got his 59-year-old father murdered for money after hiring a killer through Facebook, police said on Monday. An official said that the accused was angry at his father as he refused to give him money because of his liquor addiction and involvement in criminal activities, following which he contacted a gang from Bihar.

89.title: Members bringing placards won’t be allowed to take part in House proceedings: Birla
89.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Monday said any member who brings a placard into the House will not be allowed to take part in the House proceedings. "The government is ready to hold a discussion," Birla added. "It is the responsibility of the members to maintain the dignity of the House," he stated.

90.title: Car rams into a tree on Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway; 2 dead, 2 injured
90.article_body: Two persons died and two others were injured after their car rammed into a tree in Virar on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway, a police official said on Sunday. While the car's rear seat occupants died on the spot, the car's front seat occupants, including the driver, are seriously injured. The front seat occupants were saved by the car's airbags.

91.title: Maharashtra government issues guidelines on monkeypox infection
91.article_body: The Maharashtra government has issued guidelines on monkeypox and asked health professionals to keep a close watch on persons with symptoms that look like monkeypox. So far, there is no monkeypox case in Maharashtra. "There's no reason for panic and guidelines have been issued so that citizens can understand what monkeypox is about," Maharashtra surveillance officer Dr Pradip Awate said.

92.title: Was difficult to adapt 'Forrest Gump' in Indian context: 'Laal...' writer
92.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' writer Atul Kulkarni, while speaking about the upcoming film, said that it was difficult to adapt Tom Hanks-starrer 'Forrest Gump' in the Indian context. He added that they have made it a "desi film". "Also, [when I had written the remake years ago], I had visualised only Aamir (Khan) in the role," Atul further said.

93.title: Legend already: Shoaib Akhtar to fan asking him to describe Virat Kohli
93.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, Shoaib Akhtar was asked to describe Virat Kohli. To this, Akhtar replied saying, "Legend already." Earlier, Akhtar had also defended Kohli over his poor form, stating that Kohli didn't slam 70 international centuries in his "aunt's courtyard or while playing Candy Crush". "The criticism...is designed to make Virat stronger," he had said.

94.title: Opposition demanding discussion on price rise but Modi govt refuses: Jairam
94.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh has criticised the BJP-led Centre for allegedly refusing to discuss inflation and GST on food items in the parliament. "Combined Opposition, including TMC and AAP, has been demanding an urgent discussion...But the Modi government remains adamant and has refused. Protests continue [on Monday]. Two adjournments already and this time till 4 pm," Jairam said.

95.title: Kharge's seat didn’t commensurate with position at President’s oath ceremony: Oppn
95.article_body: After Droupadi Murmu took oath as the President of India on Monday, Opposition parties wrote to Rajya Sabha Chairman stating that the Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge was made to sit in a seat “not commensurate with the position he holds” at the event. “We’re writing to express our shock...at this deliberate disrespect shown,” the letter read.

96.title: Unjust step taken against Anganwadi workers by Delhi govt: Priyanka
96.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has criticised the Delhi government for sacking over 800 Anganwadi workers demanding increase in honorarium. "Delhi government has increased the legislators' salaries," Priyanka said. "But, taking an unjust step, the government sacked over 800 Anganwadi workers demanding a respectable honorarium. Asking for a good honorarium for hard work is not a crime," she added.

97.title: SC asks Cong leader to approach HC over law linking Aadhaar & Voter ID
97.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday directed Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala to approach the High Court over his petition challenging the Centre's June 19 notification linking Aadhaar and Voter ID cards. Surjewala stated in his petition that the law is unconstitutional and ultra vires the Constitution by violating citizens' Fundamental Right to Privacy and Right to Equality.

98.title: Tribal woman stabbed to death on suspicion of practicing witchcraft in Assam
98.article_body: A 55-year-old tribal woman was stabbed to death on suspicion of carrying out witchcraft practices in a village in Assam's Kokrajhar district. Her body was found inside her house and three people have been arrested in connection with the murder, police said. "Villagers had in the past too, tried to kill the woman, branding her as a witch," police added.

99.title: US win most gold medals at World Athletics Championships 2022, full list released
99.article_body: The US finished on top of the medal standings at the World Athletics Championships 2022, winning 13 gold, nine silver and 11 bronze medals. US are followed by Ethiopia, who bagged four gold, four silver and two bronze medals. Jamaica came third, followed by Kenya, China, Australia, Peru and Poland. India finished joint 33rd with one silver medal.

100.title: 13-yr-old Pakistani girl with neck bent at 90 degree treated by Indian doctor for free
100.article_body: Dr Rajagopalan Krishnan at Delhi's Apollo Hospital successfully operated on Pakistan's 13-year-old Afsheen Gul's neck, which was bent at 90 degree following an accident when she was 10 months old. She had fallen from her sister's arms, reported BBC News. Dr Krishnan reversed her rare muscular rotatory condition after performing four operations for free.

101.title: Gangster Meninder Dhaliwal shot dead in Canada, town put under lockdown
101.article_body: Two Indian-origin men, including 29-year-old Brothers Keepers gang member Meninder Dhaliwal, were killed in a Canadian ski town on Sunday, local media reported. Dhaliwal and his friend Satindera Gill (who wasn't involved in any gangs) were shot at, with Dhaliwal dying on the spot and Gill succumbing later. The town was reportedly locked down after the incident.

102.title: Petrol price was increased 78 times, diesel 76 times in Delhi in FY 2021-22: Govt
102.article_body: The government told the Rajya Sabha that petrol and diesel prices were increased 78 and 76 times, respectively in Delhi in FY 2021-22. The government added that petrol and diesel prices were decreased seven and 10 times, respectively during FY 2021-22. In the ongoing FY 2022-23, prices for both petrol and diesel have been increased five times so far.

103.title: Utterances of BJP leaders give rise to wrong impression: JD(U)'s Kushwaha
103.article_body: Amid rumours of a rift between the NDA allies, JD(U) and BJP, senior JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha has said that there are "no major issues" between the two parties. "But utterances of BJP leaders often give rise to a wrong impression. They [BJP] should refrain from making intemperate statements," Kushwaha, who is also an MLC from Bihar, said.

104.title: We should only give him love: Alia on Ranveer being trolled for posing nude
104.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has come out in support of Ranveer Singh who has been trolled for his nude photoshoot. She said that she doesn't like anything negative said about her "favourite co-star". "I love him. He's our favourite and he has given us so much in the movies. We should only give him love," Alia further said.

105.title: Don't call cancer patients 'bechara', they are strength personified: Chhavi
105.article_body: Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer, wrote on Instagram that she heard many caregivers use words like 'bechara (helpless)' for cancer patients. "Please don't do that! They're far from becharas, and are in fact strength personified," she added. Chhavi further wrote, "Today (Sunday) my heart beats fast as I complete 3 months since...cancer surgery."

106.title: There was no nervousness: Raj Arjun on running nude on streets in 'Dr. Arora'
106.article_body: Actor Raj Arjun has opened up about running on the streets of Bhopal without clothes for his role in Imtiaz Ali's 'Dr. Arora - Gupt Rog Visheshagya'. He said that he didn't find running naked challenging at all. "There was no nervousness in me, as I wanted to justify the role the way it was written for me," Raj added.

107.title: SRK said 'I don't co-produce but I will do it for you': Alia on 'Darlings'
107.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, while speaking to the media about her upcoming movie 'Darlings', said that actor Shah Rukh Khan told her that he does not normally co-produce a film but will do it for her. She also said that Khan said that they will have a lot of fun while co-producing the film and it will be "quite good".

108.title: 111-km Kanwar Marg project may take 2 yrs time to complete: Official
108.article_body: The proposed 111-kilometre Kanwar Marg, linking Muradnagar to Purkazi near UP-Uttarakhand border, will take another two years to get complete once Centre gives nod to the required forest clearances, a PWD official said. The proposed route will connect three districts - Ghaziabad, Meerut and Muzaffarnagar. "The entire city comes to a standstill during Kanwar Yatra," a Ghaziabad resident said.

109.title: Individual track events to have repechage rounds at Paris Olympics
109.article_body: All individual track events from 200m to 1,500m will have a repechage round at the 2024 Paris Olympics, the World Athletics Council has announced. The repechage format will replace the current format where athletes advance from round one heats to semi-finals through the fastest timings after the top placings. "Athletes will have at least two races," said the Council.

110.title: 3 killed, 2 injured after their speeding car rams into DTC bus
110.article_body: Three women were killed and two others, including a one-year-old baby, were left injured after their speeding car rammed into a stationary Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus at a depot in Delhi on Monday. The incident occurred in the morning when the bus driver was waiting for passengers to board the vehicle. The car's occupants reportedly hailed from Himachal Pradesh.

111.title: 4 Congress Lok Sabha MPs suspended for entire monsoon session amid protests
111.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Prakash Birla on Monday suspended four Congress MPs for the entire monsoon session amid huge protests by opposition members on inflation and other issues. The suspended MPs are Manickam Tagore, Ramya Haridas, Jothimani and TN Prathapan. Monday was the sixth day of the monsoon session of Parliament.

112.title: Maha man falls from bike after hitting pothole, truck crushes him to death
112.article_body: A 46-year-old man died after the bike he was travelling on got stuck in pothole on the Mumbai-Nashik highway. Reports said that the deceased and pillion rider were thrown on opposite ends of road, after which a speeding dumper truck crushed him. The pillion rider was injured in the incident. Police said that the driver ran away from the spot.

113.title: HDFC Bank to be among world's 10 most valuable banks post-merger: Report
113.article_body: HDFC Bank will be among world's top 10 most valuable banks after its merger with Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC), a Times of India report said. HDFC Bank has a market capitalisation of about $108 billion and recently moved past Citigroup, which was ranked 17th. It'll also be the first Indian bank to make it to the top 10 club.

114.title: 5 days of monsoon session wasted, govt not ready for discussion: Kharge
114.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said there has been no meaningful discussion in the House since the monsoon session of the Parliament commenced. "The government has not yet called the Opposition for talks, it is clear that the government is not ready for discussion in the House. Five days of monsoon session…have been wasted," he added.

115.title: Rainfall levels to be normal in Pune from July 29-August 4: IMD
115.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that rainfall levels will be normal in Central Maharashtra, which includes Pune district, from July 29 to August 4. According to IMD, Pune may receive light rainfall on July 25, while ghat regions around the city may report isolated heavy rainfall. After July 25, Pune and ghat regions don't have any warnings till July 30.

116.title: 3 monkeypox patients in Kerala stable now: Health Minister
116.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Monday said there is nothing to be worried about the monkeypox infection as testing and surveillance have been intensified across the state. She said the health condition of the three people who have tested positive for the disease in the state was stable. None of their primary contacts has tested positive, she added.

117.title: Sweet of her to say that: Rahul Khanna after Janhvi said she stalked him on Instagram
117.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor, during her appearance on 'Koffee with Karan', said she stalked Rahul Khanna on Instagram, saying "he has got a vibe". Reacting to Janhvi's comments, Rahul stated, "It's so sweet of her to say it...I have...met her mother (Sridevi)...I'm sure wherever Sridevi is, she'd be...proud of Janhvi." He added, "What a sweet...confident girl she has turned out to be."

118.title: Shreyas Iyer is becoming a giant of the ODI format: Aakash Chopra
118.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said India's Shreyas Iyer is becoming a giant of the ODI format. "Shreyas has struck one century, he has 11 half-centuries, he has played just 25-odd ODI matches in total, and he's gun...been ruling the roost in this format," stated Aakash. Shreyas has scored 54(57) and 63(71) in the two ODIs against West Indies so far.

119.title: Man robbed of gold by 4 people worth ₹1.68 cr in Mumbai's Dadar
119.article_body: A 25-year-old jeweller was attacked and robbed of over 3.5 kilograms of gold bars worth ₹1.68 crore by four people at Mumbai's Dadar Railway Station. The incident took place in November last year, however, the businessman filed the complaint at the Matunga Police Station last Friday. Notably, a case has been filed under IPC sections 394, 120-B and 34.

120.title: Mika Singh chooses Akanksha Puri as his wife on 'Swayamvar: Mika Di Vohti'
120.article_body: Singer Mika Singh has chosen actress Akanksha Puri to be his wife on his reality show 'Swayamvar: Mika Di Vohti'. The actress was a wild card contestant and the two have reportedly known each other for 13-14 years and are best friends. They didn't get married on the stage but Mika put a wedding garland around Akanksha's neck.

121.title: SRK's son Aryan is a buddy of mine, we chat like friends: Karan Johar
121.article_body: While speaking about connecting with the younger generation, filmmaker Karan Johar said that his friends range from actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan to actor Dharmendra. He said that Aryan Khan is like a buddy to him and that he chats with him like a friend. He also said that the younger generation gives him an "insight".

122.title: Bengaluru ranks 6th among Indian cities with worst air quality
122.article_body: Data from the Central Pollution Control Board has revealed that Bengaluru ranked sixth among cities with the worst air quality in India on Monday (July 25). The city's air quality, however, improved from 101 at 7:30 am to 67 at around 1:00 pm. BTM Layout continued to record a reading of 101 and was registered as Bengaluru's most polluted area.

123.title: My 'start-up' hero: Mahindra on man who restarted after losing business in 1984 riots
123.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra has hailed Paramjeet Singh as his "start-up hero" for restarting his life twice. Singh, who currently drives an auto-rickshaw to make a living, lost his dealership business during the 1984 riots and met with a terrible accident a few years later. "What he has done takes much more spirit and courage than...starting up a business," Mahindra tweeted.

124.title: Sensex drops 306 points, Nifty drops 88 points to end 6-day gaining streak
124.article_body: Sensex on Monday dropped 306.01 points to close at 55,766.22 while Nifty dropped 88.45 points to close at 16,631. Both indices broke their six-day gaining streak on Monday. Mahindra and Mahindra was the worst performing Sensex stock, down 3.83%, followed by Reliance Industries and Maruti Suzuki India. Tata Steel rose 3.1% as the top gainer, accompanied by IndusInd Bank.

125.title: It was a great team performance: Dhawan on India's 2-wicket win vs WI
125.article_body: Praising India following their two-wicket win against West Indies in second ODI in Port of Spain, India skipper Shikhar Dhawan said it was a great performance by his side. "Boys didn't lose the self-belief, that is amazing...I felt that we bowled nicely," he added. India have taken an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match ODI series.

126.title: 21-yr-old construction worker rapes 15-yr-old girl in Hyd, arrested
126.article_body: A 21-year-old construction worker was arrested for allegedly raping a 15-year-old girl in Hyderabad's Vanasthalipuram. According to the police, the accused lived in the same neighbourhood where the girl lived with her parents, who also worked at the same construction site. He took her to his place and raped her when her parents were away, police said.

127.title: Jason Momoa involved in head-on crash with motorcyclist while driving in Los Angeles
127.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa was involved in a head-on crash with a motorcyclist near Calabasas, Los Angeles, on Sunday morning. He was not hurt in the incident, while the motorcyclist sustained minor non-life threatening injuries. The accident took place when the motorcyclist jumped lanes and smashed into Momoa's vehicle head-on. As per reports, Momoa remained on scene throughout the investigation.

128.title: Every word in her speech had meaning, her views are commendable: Gehlot on Prez Murmu
128.article_body: After President Droupadi Murmu made her first address to the nation on Monday, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said, "Every word in her speech had a meaning. I am very impressed. The views expressed by a tribal woman are commendable." He added, "I hope she meets the commitment she made to the nation today."

129.title: Children of rape victims, unwed women can keep just mothers' names on documents: HC
129.article_body: The children of unwed women and rape victims have "fundamental rights of privacy, liberty, and dignity", the Kerala High Court said. Such children can mention their mothers' names alone on important documents, the court ruled, while allowing a man to keep just his mother's name on his birth and identity certificates. The court called such people "new age 'Karnas'".

130.title: I'd love to do a web series whenever I get a chance: Kartik Aaryan
130.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has said that he would "love" to do a web series when he gets a chance. "If I like a script...see if I can do something different or new, which I haven't explored before, I'd like to work in one," he stated. Kartik was recently seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and will next feature in 'Shehzada'.

131.title: She doesn't need a bullet to kill you: SRK on Deepika's look from 'Pathaan'
131.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone took to Instagram to share a motion poster featuring her from the movie 'Pathaan'. "Tadaa!" she wrote on Instagram. Actor Shah Rukh Khan also shared the poster on Twitter and wrote, "She doesn't need a bullet to kill you!" Deepika also mentioned that the movie will be available in Hindi, Tamil and Telugu.

132.title: Liquor shop in Gurugram robbed at gunpoint, men escape with ₹5 lakh
132.article_body: A liquor outlet in Gurugram's Sector-47 was allegedly robbed on Saturday night. The armed men, who were seen entering the store on CCTV camera footage, allegedly threatened the salespersons at gunpoint and escaped with around ₹5 lakh cash, although the exact sum hasn't been disclosed yet. The accused allegedly fired in the air when the salespersons tried to stop them.

133.title: 2 labourers killed, 1 injured at construction site in Gurugram
133.article_body: Two labourers were killed and one was injured after soil caved in at a construction site on a plot in Gurugram's Begumpur Khatola on Sunday evening. Police said that the plot shared a boundary wall with a scaffolding company which collapsed and the labourers got buried under the soil. They were rushed to a hospital where two were declared dead.

134.title: Man climbs atop train at Secunderabad station, suffers burn injuries
134.article_body: A 30-year-old man climbed a goods train at Secunderabad railway station on Saturday night and suffered severe burns after coming in contact with live wires. The man, identified as Pushpendra Kumar, reportedly fell down between the gap of two bogies after the train started. He suffered 60% burn injuries and is currently undergoing treatment in a hospital.

135.title: Ingebrigtsen beats Olympic champions to win 5,000m gold at World C'ships
135.article_body: Norway's Jakob Ingebrigtsen defeated Tokyo Olympics champions to win gold in men's 5,000m at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon. Ingebrigtsen clocked 13:09:24 to finish ahead of 5,000m Olympic champion and world record holder Joshua Cheptegei, who finished ninth. Ethiopia's Selemon Barega, who won the 10,000m gold at Tokyo Olympics, finished 12th in the race.

136.title: RBI correct to use forex reserves to tackle Rupee volatility: EAC member
136.article_body: Sanjeev Sanyal, a member of Economic Advisory Council (EAC) to the Prime Minister, said RBI is "correct to use" foreign exchange reserves to tackle Rupee's volatility. "There's no point targeting an INR/USD level when USD is appreciating against all other [major currencies]," Sanyal said. "We need to maintain overall macro-stability and allow the cycle to play itself out," he added.

137.title: Partha called Mamata 4 times after arrest starting at 2:32 am, she didn't pick up: Memo
137.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee called state Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee at least four times after his arrest on Saturday. According to arrest memo, Chatterjee was arrested at 1:55 am on Saturday and called the TMC party chief at least four times between 2:32 am and 9:35 am. "He called her but she didn't take his call," arrest memo said.

138.title: After Kallakurichi incident, another Class 12 student found dead in hostel room in TN
138.article_body: After the Kallakurichi incident, another class 12 student has allegedly died by suicide inside her hostel room in Tamil Nadu's Thiruvallur. She had reportedly told her friends she would come late to school but when she did not turn up, checks were made in hostel, where she was found dead. Case has been transferred to CBCID.

139.title: Watershed moment for India: PM Modi as Droupadi Murmu takes oath as President
139.article_body: As Droupadi Murmu took oath as the 15th President of India on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that her assuming the Presidency is a watershed moment for India, especially for the poor, marginalised and downtrodden. "I wish her the very best for a fruitful Presidential tenure," PM Modi tweeted. She defeated Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Thursday.

140.title: Debt-ridden Pune trader stages armed robbery to gain sympathy: Police
140.article_body: A debt-ridden garment trader in Pune staged an armed robbery at his home to gain sympathy from lenders to whom he owed around ₹42 lakh, police said on Sunday. The trader, in his complaint, said that his house was ransacked when his wife was alone at home, adding that the robbers held her at knifepoint and escaped with gold.

141.title: 3 men guised as trans women rob new mom of gold chain in Mumbai
141.article_body: Three men were arrested on Sunday for impersonating trans women and cheating a new mother of her gold chain worth ₹50,000 in Mumbai. The accused told the woman that her newborn was born with evil spirits, blessed her gold chain to get rid of them and advised her to keep it under a pillow for seven days.

142.title: Uddhav camp moves SC against Shinde group's plea to stake claim over Sena
142.article_body: Shiv Sena faction led by Uddhav Thackeray has moved the Supreme Court against the Election Commission's proceedings on Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led group's plea for recognition as the real Shiv Sena. The EC had asked Shiv Sena's rival factions to submit documents by August 8 to prove their majority. The Shinde group has also sought claim on party symbol.

143.title: It hasn't freed up my calendar: De Kock on schedule despite Test retirement
143.article_body: South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock has said despite being retired from Test cricket, his calendar is still packed due to the international cricket schedule. "It's going to start being tough for players, three formats is a lot and it looks like more games are happening over the calendar," he added. "Players need to make decisions individually," he further said.

144.title: Drone lifeguard saves 14-year-old from drowning on a Spanish beach
144.article_body: A drone lifeguard service saved the life of a 14-year-old boy as he struggled against a powerful tide off a beach in Spain's Valencia, the drone's operators said. The drone dropped a life vest to help the boy stay afloat until a physical lifeguard team arrived. The boy was treated at a local hospital and was later sent home.

145.title: Mamata didn't pick Partha's call, he's being left alone: West Bengal BJP MP
145.article_body: West Bengal Bharatiya Janata Party MP Saumitra Khan said that state minister Partha Chatterjee called state Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee at the time of his arrest but Banerjee did not pick up his call. He reportedly added that Chatterjee did the scam on Banerjee's instructions but now was being "left alone".

146.title: 2 students from Pune secure 3rd rank in ISC Class 12 exam results
146.article_body: Two students from The Bishop's School in Pune have secured all-India third rank, along with 76 others, scoring 99.25% in Indian School Certificate (ISC) Class 12 exam results. Kalpana Panda and Kanishk Sujai Hegde are from the science and commerce streams respectively. "I am looking forward to [studying in] one of the top engineering colleges in [India]," Panda said.

147.title: Smuggler arrested with cannabis worth ₹1 crore in UP's Raebareli
147.article_body: A smuggler was arrested by police with 4.48 quintals of cannabis worth ₹1 crore from the Bhadokhar area of Raebareli, Uttar Pradesh. The accused, Sanjay Singh, was alleged to be a member of a gang which smuggled narcotics from Odisha. Sanjay would allegedly transport the drugs in a tanker and get ₹25,000 for each trip, police said.

148.title: Man who stalked Katrina, sent death threats to her and Vicky on social media arrested
148.article_body: The man who stalked Katrina Kaif and sent death threats to her and Vicky Kaushal through social media has been arrested, Mumbai Police said. Vicky had filed a complaint against the accused after which a case was registered under several sections of the IPC and IT Act at the Santacruz Police Station in Mumbai.

149.title: Truck overturns after hitting toll plaza in Dehradun, woman saves toll booth worker
149.article_body: A CCTV footage showing a truck crashing into a toll booth after trying to avoid ramming into a car in Dehradun has surfaced online. The footage further showed a woman running towards the toll booth to pull out a worker to safety just seconds after the crash. A woman was injured in the accident and was sent to a hospital.

150.title: It's like Dhoni hitting six for World Cup: Vivek Dubey on National Award win
150.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Dubey spoke about winning National Award for Best Feature Film on Social Issues for his debut feature film 'Funral' and said, "It's a different feeling." "You're in your house, casually looking at...results...and then your film's name is announced, it's like Dhoni hitting...six for...World Cup," he added. "I still can't believe it...It's like having...news of a baby," said Vivek.

151.title: Proud that 'Soorarai...' won 5 Nat'l Awards, Tamil industry won 10: Kamal
151.article_body: On Twitter, Kamal Haasan said he's "proud" that Suriya-starrer 'Soorarai Pottru' won five National Awards. The Tamil film won National Awards for Best Feature Film, Best Screenplay and Best Music Direction (Background Music). 'Soorarai Pottru' actors Suriya and Aparna Balamurali were named Best Actor and Best Actress, respectively. "Tamil film industry bagged 10 awards in total," Kamal added.

152.title: Tribal community set to make a new beginning: Arjun Munda on Prez Murmu
152.article_body: Soon after Droupadi Murmu took oath as the 15th President of India, Union Minister Arjun Munda said that tribal community is set to make a new beginning, with a tribal woman holding the highest office of the land. "This constitutional position is above the party lines," he added. Notably, Murmu is the first tribal woman to take charge as President.

153.title: Border calls for allowing 'natural' ball-tampering, says 'What's wrong with scratching?'
153.article_body: Former Australia captain Allan Border has called for allowing 'natural' ball-tampering in cricket. "If you get the ball in your hand...just scratching the ball and working on it over a period of time, and you get the ball reverse swinging...what's wrong with that?" he said. "It's not a bad idea because on flat wickets you need something," he added.

154.title: ‘Droupadi' isn't my original name, was given to me by my teacher: President Murmu
154.article_body: The newly-elected President of India said 'Droupadi' is not her "original" first name and was given to her by her teacher. Murmu said her Santhali name is 'Puti', adding, "The teacher didn't like my previous name and changed it for good." In Santhali culture, a girl takes her grandmother's name, Murmu who took the oath of office on Monday, said.

155.title: Parents are getting desperate, but I'm not sure: Adivi Sesh on marriage
155.article_body: 'Major' actor Adivi Sesh, when asked about marriage plans, said, "[My parents]...are getting desperate, but I'm not sure." The 37-year-old actor added "at some point" he may consider it, but, for now, he isn't inclined towards it. Further, talking about his 'non-controversial image', Adivi said, "I don't drink, smoke...or eat non-veg food...If I'm not working, I sleep on time; that's...it."

156.title: Unlike earlier rebellions, this coup is to finish off Sena forever: Thackeray
156.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray said unlike earlier rebellions in the party, the revolt this time was aimed at “finishing off” the party. "Unlike the earlier rebellions, this coup is to finish off the Shiv Sena forever. They have hired professional agencies to counter us. This is a battle between money and loyalty," Thackeray added.

157.title: Terror suspect, who worked as delivery executive, arrested in B'luru
157.article_body: Bengaluru Police's Central Crime Branch, in a joint operation with central agencies, arrested a terror suspect in Bengaluru who worked as a food delivery executive. The suspect, Akthar Hussain from Assam, resided with 4 other people, who were also detained for questioning. According to officials, the accused was in constant touch with a terror organisation through his Telegram account.

158.title: 39-yr-old man repeatedly rapes 7-yr-old daughter in Pune, arrested
158.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested a 39-year-old man for allegedly raping his 7-year-old daughter multiple times, officers said. According to the FIR lodged by the survivor's mother, the man raped his daughter multiple times since March this year. The girl recently told her mother about the incident, following which the woman filed a complaint against her husband, officers said.

159.title: Rajya Sabha seats offered for up to ₹100 crore by fraudsters, CBI busts racket
159.article_body: A multi-state racket attempting to cheat people by promising them Rajya Sabha seats, Governorship, central government postings etc has been busted by the CBI, officials said. One of the imposters named in the racket allegedly posed as a senior CBI officer to cheat people to the tune of ₹100 crore. Around five people have been charged in the case.

160.title: Needed one with physicality not brain, picked Salman: Chiranjeevi on Godfather
160.article_body: When asked about why he did not approach him for a role in the film 'Godfather', actor Chiranjeevi told actor Aamir Khan that the 'Godfather' character did not need someone with heart and brain. "[It] needed someone for their physicality, and that's why we went with Salman [Khan]," Chiranjeevi added. The two then laughed about their conversation.

161.title: Vivo indulged in money laundering, challenged India's integrity: ED
161.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate told the Delhi High Court that Vivo India indulged in money laundering to destabilise the financial system and challenge the integrity and sovereignty of the country. In an affidavit, ED said Vivo India incorporated 22 firms in different states which allegedly laundered money. It added that it is scanning the suspicious financial transactions of these 22 firms.

162.title: You might be investing incorrectly, it's time for real experts: dezerv.
162.article_body: Wealthtech dezerv. launched a campaign highlighting reckless investing behaviour. The brand mentions that people are recognizing the importance of investing, but they're investing through amateur tips from friends, financial influencers & Google searches. dezerv. calls out these patterns as gambling away money and stated that those who want to create wealth need real experts to invest for them.

163.title: Can't even handle his family, how would he handle me?: Rajbhar to Akhilesh
163.article_body: SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar, who recently broke alliance with Samajwadi Party (SP), criticised Akhilesh Yadav saying that he couldn't even handle his family members. "Alright, he says that I am wrong. But Shivpal is his uncle...He cannot even handle his own uncle, his sister-in-law, his own family, how would he handle me?" he told reporters.

164.title: PM 'Kisan Harassment' scheme: Rahul criticises Centre on farmer issues
164.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre on farmer issues. "PM 'Kisan Harassment' scheme...no compensation for martyred farmers...no data on farmers suicide...insurance companies getting profits of ₹40,000 crore in the name of crop insurance," Rahul tweeted. He added, "Government was supposed to double the farmers' income by 2022 but have doubled their 'sufferings'."

165.title: Filmmakers never offered me serious roles: Actress Mallika Sherawat
165.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat has said that she always wanted to play different parts in films. Speaking about the serious roles, the actress said, "It is not like I never wanted to play serious parts, the filmmakers never offered me one." Mallika, who played Gulabo in 'RK/RKay', wished more filmmakers cast her in such roles.

166.title: Small trainer aircraft crashes in Pune, 22-year-old woman pilot injured; video surfaces
166.article_body: A small trainer aircraft of Carver Aviation, Baramati, on a solo cross-country flight made a crash landing in Maharashtra's Pune district on Monday. A 22-year-old woman pilot named Bhavika Rathod was injured in the incident, reported ANI. The aircraft crashed in a farm in Kadbanwadi village of Indapur taluka in Pune district around 11.30 am, added ANI.

167.title: Who is Google Co-founder's wife Nicole, who allegedly had an affair with Musk?
167.article_body: Nicole Shanahan, the wife of Google Co-founder Sergey Brin who allegedly had an affair with Elon Musk, is a Silicon Valley-based entrepreneur, attorney, and philanthropist. Shanahan is the founder of legal tech firm ClearAccessIP, which was acquired in 2020. She recently started the Bia-Echo Foundation and pledged $100 million to areas such as reproductive longevity and criminal justice reform.

168.title: I don't know what's the plan in holding Chahal back: Ajit Agarkar
168.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has questioned India's plan to bring Yuzvendra Chahal into bowling in the 17th over during the second West Indies ODI. "Why not get Chahal in the game early...try and pick up wickets...he was a bit greedy trying to pick wickets towards the end," stated Agarkar. Chahal conceded 69 runs in his nine overs in the game.

169.title: Was an exhaustive process of 6 months: Janhvi on 'Mr and Mrs Mahi'
169.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up about preparing for the role of a cricketer in her upcoming project 'Mr and Mrs Mahi'. "It was an exhaustive process of six months to get into the skin of the character," she stated. "It has been a physically intensive film for Janhvi as she also maintained a strict protein-heavy diet," a source stated.

170.title: Online gambling rackets busted in Pune; 16 arrested
170.article_body: The Pune Police have busted online gambling rackets in the city and have arrested 16 people connected to it. Notably, three online gambling dens were allegedly being run under the garb of lottery and video gaming centres in the city's Kondhwa area, police said. The racketeers were using various online gambling applications, including Matka gambling, police added.

171.title: Tired of suspicious nature, Punjab woman pushes husband in canal; held
171.article_body: The body of 30-year-old man was found in Punjab's Ganda Kheri canal. His wife and mother-in-law have been arrested in the case. Reports said the two women had taken the man to canal under pretext of performing some rituals and had pushed him. The wife admitted that she killed her husband as she was fed up of his "suspicious" nature.

172.title: Twitter data of 54 lakh users, including celebs, put on sale for ₹24 lakh by hacker
172.article_body: The personal data of 54 lakh Twitter users has been put on sale on a hacker forum for $30,000 (about ₹24 lakh). The database contains information on users, including celebrities and companies, the hacker claimed. The hacker said they used a vulnerability that allows anybody without authentication to obtain any Twitter ID by submitting a phone number or an email.

173.title: People devoid of development for yrs can see me as their reflection: Murmu
173.article_body: After taking oath as the 15th President of India, Droupadi Murmu on Monday said that her nomination has blessings of the poor behind it.
