"Satisfying to me that the people who were devoid of development for years, the poor, Dalits, backwards and the tribals, can see me as their reflection," she added.

174.title: Debt-ridden B'luru man who killed landlady by stabbing her 91 times held
174.article_body: A debt-ridden man, who had lost ₹12 lakh in the stock market, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his 75-year-old landlady, Bengaluru Police said. The postmortem report revealed he had stabbed the landlady 91 times. The accused murdered her on July 2 to steal her gold ornaments to pay his debts. He had also taken loan of ₹50,000 from her.

175.title: Moment of pride: Bhushan as 3 films produced by T-Series win Nat'l Awards
175.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar has reacted after 'Toolsidas Junior', 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' and 'Saina' won awards at the 68th National Film Awards. These films were produced by Bhushan's company. "I'm happy...all the hard work...by the entire team at T-Series...has been rewarded. It's definitely a moment of pride and honour for the entire team," he stated.

176.title: UP ex-MLA's son arrested by STF for gang rape, cheating from Pune
176.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force arrested former UP MLA Vijay Mishra's son from Pune on charges of gang rape and cheating. The accused, Vishnu Mishra, had been absconding since August 2020 and had a bounty of ₹1 lakh on his head, police said. Notably, Vijay has been in jail since 2020 on charges of property grabbing and cheating.

177.title: Mumbai's Aarey Road temporarily closed for vehicular movement
177.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police issued a press release on Monday stating that Aarey road will remain temporarily shut for vehicular movement from midnight of July 25 to July 26. The vehicular movement has been suspended due to various works being carried out by the Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation (MMRC) and Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai (MCGM).

178.title: Johar announces 'Screw Dheela' with Tiger, to be helmed by Shashank Khaitan
178.article_body: Karan Johar on Monday announced his next production venture 'Screw Dheela', starring Tiger Shroff in the lead role. "Arriving with a solid punch of entertainment, super excited to present Tiger Shroff in #ScrewDheela," Johar wrote, while sharing a teaser of the film. The project will be helmed by Shashank Khaitan, known for films like 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania' and 'Dhadak'.

179.title: 999 cattle die of skin disease in Guj, 37,000 treated; 2.68 lakh vaccinated
179.article_body: Gujarat Agriculture and Animal Husbandry Minister Raghavji Patel said that 999 cattle, especially cows and buffaloes, have died of a lumpy skin disease. A government release said the viral disease has been reported in 14 districts of the state where over 37,000 animals have been treated. The release added that 2.68 lakh cattle have been vaccinated to prevent its spread.

180.title: I'd like to see Arshdeep make his ODI debut in final match vs WI: Parthiv
180.article_body: Ex-India wicket-keeper Parthiv Patel has said pacer Arshdeep Singh should make his ODI debut in the final match against West Indies. "I want to see how Arshdeep copes with bowling 10 overs in the heat...Having a left-handed bowler gives you a slight advantage," stated Parthiv. Arshdeep made his international debut in the first T20I against England.

181.title: Suriya & Akshay are very different as actors: Sudha on 'Soorarai...' remake
181.article_body: 'Soorarai Pottru' director Sudha Kongara, who'll also be helming the film's Hindi remake starring Akshay Kumar, said the upcoming remake will be very different in terms of the situation and the actors. "Both Suriya and Akshay sir are very different as actors...He (Akshay) brings his own interpretation to the character," Sudha added. The remake will also feature Radhika Madan.

182.title: Google Co-founder gave Musk $500,000 for Tesla during 2008 financial crisis: Report
182.article_body: Google Co-founder Sergey Brin reportedly gave Elon Musk $500,000 for Tesla during the 2008 financial crisis, when the company was struggling to increase production. According to The Wall Street Journal report which stated that Musk had an affair with Brin's wife, the former gave Brin one of Tesla's first all-electric sports-utility vehicles in 2015.

183.title: BJP govt threatened since AAP formed govt in 2 states: AAP leader
183.article_body: AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj said since AAP has formed governments in two states, BJP has started feeling "threatened". His statement came after Delhi LG VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into alleged violation of Delhi Excise Policy. "Ever since Arvind Kejriwal has come up in form of PM Modi’s biggest challenge…BJP government…asked all agencies to persecute AAP ministers," Bharadwaj added.

184.title: ED takes Partha Chatterjee to AIIMS Bhubaneswar after Calcutta HC order
184.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate took West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee to AIIMS Bhubaneswar through air-ambulance on Monday. This came after Chatterjee complained of "uneasiness". Chatterjee was earlier sent to SSKM Hospital on local court's order. However, ED had approached the Calcutta High Court against the local court's order, after which, the High Court had ordered the shift to AIIMS.

185.title: Mann nahi karta: Woman's chat with Uber driver during Delhi rain goes viral
185.article_body: A Twitter user shared a screenshot of her chat with an Uber driver during a day of rainfall in Delhi. Upon telling him her drop location, the driver said, "Iss mausam mein (In this weather)", to which she asked if he was coming or not. He answered, "Kya karun. Mann nahi karta. (What to do. I don't feel like it)."

186.title: Our industry needs to up its game as audience can view global content: Farhan
186.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar, comparing the Indian film industry with the west, said, "We...may not have huge spending power on VFX or budgets like the films in the west, but we need to up our game." According to him, the audience now has access to content from all over the world. Recently, Farhan had featured in the Marvel series 'Ms Marvel'.

187.title: BJP govt working to make Indian Muslims 2nd-class citizens: Owaisi
187.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday said that the BJP government is working towards making the Indian Muslims as "second-class citizens". "The data given by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs reveals that out of the 32.26 lakh loans meant for street vendors under the SVANidhi scheme, only 331 loans were disbursed to minorities," Owaisi added.

188.title: Hyd RPO decides to release additional passport appointment slots at PSKs
188.article_body: Hyderabad's Regional Passport Office (RPO) has decided to release additional passport appointment slots at Passport Seva Kendras (PSKs) from Monday. This decision was reportedly taken due to the rise in demand for passports, especially after the lockdown. RPO will now release 150 additional slots daily in Passport Seva Kendras located in Begumpet, Ameerpet, Tolichowki, Nizamabad and Karimnagar.

189.title: 5 of family returning from b'day party killed as their car gets hit in K'taka
189.article_body: Five members of a family were killed and four others were injured in a road accident in Karnataka's Koppal district on Saturday. They were returning from a birthday party, police said. "Prima facie, it looks like a lorry has hit the Scorpio vehicle leading to accident. We have found a spare part of other vehicle," Koppal SP Arunangshu Giri said.

190.title: We thought it could be done because of IPL experience: Axar on 64*(35) vs WI
190.article_body: India all-rounder Axar Patel said they knew they could chase down West Indies' 312-run target after being 212/5 in 40 overs due to their experience from IPL. "When I went out, I aimed for 10-11 an over. We thought it could be done because of IPL experience," he stated. Axar smashed three 4s and five 6s in his 64-run innings.

191.title: Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal get death threats, Mumbai Police begin probe
191.article_body: Actors Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have received threats to their lives from an unidentified person on social media, reported ANI on Monday. Mumbai Police also informed that a case has been registered against the unidentified person and an investigation has been initiated. Mumbai Police added that the case has been registered at the Santacruz Police Station.

192.title: A person of extraordinary courage: Mahindra on President Droupadi Murmu
192.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Monday took to Twitter to praise India’s 15th President, Droupadi Murmu. Sharing a video, Mahindra wrote, "Look no further for your Monday Motivation Above all else, she is a person of extraordinary courage and a commitment to serve. Her inner strength has enabled her to withstand all the challenges life has thrown at her."

193.title: Moving car catches fire on Maha's Mira-Bhayandar Road, no casualties reported
193.article_body: A moving white sedan car reportedly caught fire on Mira-Bhayander Road near Mumbai. Reports said that the driver of the car and a woman who was inside the vehicle came out immediately after it caught fire. The incident took place near the Bhayander Golden Nest Circle. Reports added that no injuries or casualties were reported during the incident.

194.title: Youth Cong leader in Gujarat arrested for throwing ink on posters of CM, PM
194.article_body: A Youth Congress leader in Gujarat's Bharuch district was arrested for allegedly throwing ink on the posters of CM Bhupendra Patel and PM Narendra Modi. The accused, Nikhil Shah, was protesting at the Bharuch Collector's office against the Enforcement Directorate's questioning of Sonia Gandhi. Shah had "secretly brought an ink pen" and was arrested under IPC's section 505, police said.

195.title: Musk dropped to one knee, begged forgiveness from Brin over affair with wife: Report
195.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly "dropped to one knee" in front of Google Co-founder Sergey Brin at a party while apologising and begging for forgiveness for an alleged affair with his wife, Nicole Shanahan. While Brin acknowledged the apology, he isn't speaking to Musk regularly, the report added. Meanwhile, Musk dismissed the report, calling the alleged affair "total bs".

196.title: Ranbir can portray finer nuances of every role effectively: Anil Kapoor
196.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor has said that his 'Animal' co-star Ranbir Kapoor is an actor who can portray the finer nuances of every role effectively. He also called Ranbir talented and hard-working. Speaking about 'Animal', Anil said, "I liked the story...Sandeep Reddy Vanga (director) narrated to me, and I was sure that I wanted to be part of the film."

197.title: Tobi Amusan breaks world record in 100m hurdles in semis, wins gold in final
197.article_body: Nigeria's Tobi Amusan broke the women's 100m hurdles world record in the semi-final and won the gold medal in the final at the World Athletics Championships. Amusan clocked 12.12 seconds in the semi-final, breaking the previous mark of 12.20 by 0.08 seconds. She won gold in 12.06 seconds, however, this wasn't recognised as a world record due to illegal tailwind.

198.title: Encourage use of bhang, cannabis as alternative to liquor to prevent crime: BJP MLA
198.article_body: Chhattisgarh BJP MLA Krishnamurti Bandhi suggested that use of bhang and cannabis should be encouraged as an alternative to liquor for addiction. He claimed that persons addicted to these substances hardly commit offences like rape, murder and dacoity. "Once I had discussed it in Assembly...Somewhere alcohol is the reason for rape, murder and quarrel...It's my personal opinion," he added.

199.title: Noida authority to remove more illegal buildings on floodplains
199.article_body: The Noida authority has issued warning notices to at least 500 house owners to remove illegal structures from Hindon floodplains or face demolition. The notices have been issued under a mega drive, aimed at freeing floodplains of the Hindon and Yamuna rivers. In June, the authority had demolished at least 100 farmhouses built on the Yamuna floodplains.

200.title: Koreans don't know a lot about our industry but they know SRK: Anushka Sen
200.article_body: Actress Anushka Sen, who recently travelled to South Korea for her debut Korean project, spoke about how the people there don't know a lot about Indian cinema. "I was telling them about...our culture, industry, films. They don't know a lot about it...But they know...Shah Rukh Khan," she added. Anushka further said South Korean people are "really hyped about Indian food".

201.title: I want to collaborate with Justin Bieber and Charlie Puth: Armaan Malik
201.article_body: Singer-songwriter Armaan Malik has said he wants to collaborate with Justin Bieber and Charlie Puth. "Justin Bieber and Charlie Puth are my favourite artistes," he added. "Charlie Puth is someone I really love. I love his musicality, the way he writes and produces...I feel like when we get together in the studio, some magic is bound to happen," said Armaan.

202.title: Arunachal logs 82 new COVID-19 cases, biggest one-day spike in July
202.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh on Sunday reported 82 new cases of COVID-19, taking the state's active case tally to 363, a senior official informed. This is the biggest single-day spike in fresh cases in July, the official added. The state's coronavirus death toll remained unchanged at 296 as no new COVID-19-related deaths were reported there in the past 24 hours.

203.title: My election is proof the poor in India can dream & make it come true: President Murmu
203.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu in her first address said, "My election is proof that the poor in India can dream and also make their dreams come true." She added, "I started my journey from a small tribal village in Odisha...it was like a dream for me to get elementary education...I became the first daughter of my village to go to college."

204.title: Zomato investors lose ₹89,000 crore in 7 months as stock falls to record low
204.article_body: About ₹89,000 crore has been wiped out of Zomato investors' wealth in seven months as the food delivery company's stock fell to a record low on Monday. Shares of Zomato declined over 13% to ₹46 on the NSE in early trade. The company's market value declined to ₹36,848 crore, from a peak of over ₹1.25 lakh crore in November 2021.

205.title: Axar smashes most sixes by an Indian batting at no. 7 in a successful ODI run chase
205.article_body: India all-rounder Axar Patel set the record for smashing most sixes batting at number seven or lower by an Indian in a successful ODI run chase. The 28-year-old smashed five sixes as India chased down a 312-run target in the second ODI against West Indies. The previous record was jointly held by MS Dhoni and Yusuf Pathan (three sixes each).

206.title: Mumbai's drinking water fountains to come back, heritage circuit to be made
206.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has decided to restore 18 drinking water fountains called 'pyaus' and create heritage tourist circuit of these structures. Reports said some 'pyaus' were constructed with troughs for horses and cattle. Reports quoted experts as saying that 80-100 'pyaus' may have disappeared over the years. Some have been traced with help of history, photographs and films.

207.title: Design of supersonic jet that can fly from New York to London in 3.5 hours unveiled
207.article_body: US-based Boom Supersonic recently unveiled the latest design for a supersonic jet that can potentially fly from New York to London in 3.5 hours. Dubbed 'Overture', the jet is said to be the world's fastest airliner. The jet can fly at the speeds of 2,100 kmph over water with a range of 4,250 nautical miles and can carry 65-80 passengers.

208.title: Hope to score a century in next game: Shreyas Iyer on 2 consecutive fifties
208.article_body: After his two consecutive half-centuries in the ongoing ODI series against West Indies, Team India batter Shreyas Iyer has said he's hopeful of scoring a century in the third and final ODI. "You don't get such kind of starts every time in international cricket," he added. Iyer scored 54(57) in the first ODI and 63(71) in the second.

209.title: 144 blood bags found in Patna fridge, 2 held for running illegal blood bank
209.article_body: Two people were arrested for running an unauthorised blood bank after 144 polybags filled with blood were found in a small fridge used to store vegetables in Patna. Polybags did not have date of collection or group of blood. Police said the accused used to collect blood from the smackers and sold it to different hospitals for ₹3,000 per bag.

210.title: 400 chickens die as tempo overturns on Mumbai-Nashik highway
210.article_body: At least 400 chickens died on Mumbai-Nashik highway after the tempo transporting them overturned, a police official said. "The incident took place at Padgha toll naka when the tempo driver tried to avoid a truck that was overtaking it," he said. The chickens were supposed to be delivered to a shop in Thane's Wagle Estate, he added.

211.title: Democracy without independent judiciary is hollow: Gauhati HC judge
211.article_body: Gauhati High Court Justice N Kotiswar Singh on Sunday said that democracy without an independent judiciary is hollow. "Judiciary is one of the important limbs of democracy," Justice Singh added. He addressed an event to lay the foundation stone of a court-cum-office building of the Gauhati bench of the Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT).

212.title: What is the rate at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
212.article_body: Infosys has reported the highest rate at which employees are leaving the company among its Indian peers for April-June quarter, at 28.4%. The IT major is followed by HCL Tech with 23.8% employee attrition rate, Wipro at 23.3% and TCS at 19.7%. Meanwhile, Infosys added the most number of employees during the quarter, followed by Wipro, TCS and HCL Tech.

213.title: Never thought I’d do more than a movie: Shruti Haasan on completing 13 yrs
213.article_body: Shruti Haasan took to Instagram after she completed 13 years in the film industry. "I never...thought I'd do more than a movie, even [though] I wasn't born to do this, I learned to love it," her caption read. "Cinema has become the greatest source of joy in my life...it has given me the life I'm so grateful for," she added.

214.title: Droupadi Murmu takes oath as the 15th President of India
214.article_body: President-elect Droupadi Murmu took oath as the 15th President of India on Monday. Chief Justice of India NV Ramana administered the oath to her in the central hall of the Parliament . She scripted history on Thursday after defeating Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha to become the first tribal and the second woman to hold the top constitutional post.

215.title: Zomato share price falls by 13% to hit all-time low of ₹46
215.article_body: Zomato's share price declined by 13% on Monday to hit an all-time low of ₹46 during early trade as the one-year lock-in for promoters, shareholders, employees and others ended today. The stock had last closed at ₹53.65 on Friday. Zomato was listed on the markets on July 23, 2021, and hit its lifetime high of ₹169 apiece in November 2021.

216.title: Telangana resident shows Monkeypox symptoms, samples sent to Pune
216.article_body: A 40-year-old man, who returned from Kuwait to Telangana's Kamareddy on July 6, has shown symptoms of monkeypox, state health officials said. The patient has been shifted to Government Fever Hospital and his samples have been sent to Pune's NIV lab. Health officials have identified six people who were in contact with the person and have kept them in isolation.

217.title: Folding Ganpati rath planned for 1st time to avoid clash with Pune Metro line
217.article_body: To avoid clash with Pune Metro line above Lakdi Pul bridge, Tulshibaug Ganpati mandal has decided to make a folding rath for the procession for the first time. "Total height of the overhead Metro is 21 feet...height of our Ganpati statue itself is 18 feet and the entire rath height goes up to 25 to 30 feet," mandal secretary said.

218.title: People of PoK look to India questioning when will they get freedom: RSS leader
218.article_body: RSS leader Dattatreya Hosabale said that the people of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir look towards India questioning when will they get freedom. "Since 1947, Pakistan has made every attempt to propagate terrorism, separatism and war in J&K," he added. "People of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir are the first victims. They should get complete justice. They are longing today," he stated.

219.title: India reports 16,866 new COVID-19 cases; list of states with most active cases released
219.article_body: India has reported 16,866 COVID-19 cases, 18,148 recoveries and 41 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,279 cases and 36 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,50,877, while the death toll reached 5,26,074.

220.title: My biggest cheerleader always: Kunal Kemmu mourns grandmother's demise
220.article_body: Kunal Kemmu took to Instagram on Sunday to share the news of his maternal grandmother's demise. He also shared a picture featuring him, his daughter Inaaya and his 'naani'. Along with the picture, Kunal wrote, "I have such special and amazing memories of her telling me stories, feeding me...and always telling me to believe in myself. My biggest cheerleader always."

221.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Imtiaz Ali told me to never leave acting: Sanjana Sanghi
221.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi, who made her film debut in Imtiaz Ali's directorial 'Rockstar', has said that Ranbir Kapoor used to hold her hand through the film's sets. "That's what made me fall in love with filmmaking. Ranbir and Imtiaz told me...I should never leave acting...pushed me further...told my mother about it," she added. Sanjana played Nargis Fakhri's sister in 'Rockstar'.

222.title: We lost the game in the last 6 overs: Nicholas Pooran after defeat vs India
222.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said they lost the second ODI against India in the last six overs of the game. "[In] the last couple of overs, we didn't hold our nerves...We just needed one wicket to seal the game but Axar played really well," stated Pooran. Axar Patel smashed unbeaten 64 runs off 35 balls to help India win.

223.title: Chitra told ED that staff's phones were tapped to check information leak: Officials
223.article_body: Former NSE MD Chitra Ramkrishna has told the Enforcement Directorate that monitoring of phones at the bourses was done to ensure there was no leak of critical data such as passwords and other reports to the competitors, said officials. Meanwhile, ED said her act was clear "illegal interception" as employees were not aware that their calls were put under surveillance.

224.title: Miss you Manny: Sanjana remembers Sushant on 2 yrs of Dil Bechara
224.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post marking two years since the release of her film 'Dil Bechara'. In her note, she said that she missed Manny, the character played by late actor Sushant Singh Rajput in the film. "Thank you for all your love, it has truly been insurmountable," Sanjana further wrote.

225.title: 8 killed, 20 injured as 2 double-decker buses collide on UP's Purvanchal Expressway
225.article_body: Eight people were killed while nearly 20 were injured after collision of two double-decker buses took place on Uttar Pradesh's Purvanchal expressway on Monday. Three people are critical and have been referred to Trauma Center in Lucknow for treatment, officials were quoted by reports as saying. CM Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over incident.

226.title: Was getting typecast, had romantic image on-screen: Ranbir on 'Shamshera'
226.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he was getting typecast in coming-of-age films. "I had this romantic image on-screen," he added. Speaking about 'Shamshera', Ranbir said, "This was a big deal for me because a lot of people don't offer me these kinds of roles." He stated it's his duty as an actor to try and get out of his comfort zone.

227.title: Boat carrying Haitian migrants sinks off Bahamas; 17 people dead
227.article_body: Security forces have recovered the bodies of 17 people and rescued 25 others after a boat carrying Haitian migrants capsized off the coast of the Bahamas, about 11 km from New Providence, on Sunday, according to the authorities. Bahamas PM Philip Brave Davis said that it's presumed that more people are missing. A multi-agency investigation has been launched, he added.

228.title: Maharashtra govt will fall due to its internal fights: Sanjay Raut
228.article_body: After Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil said it was decided with a "heavy heart" that Eknath Shinde would become the new CM of state, Shiv Sena’s Sanjay Raut said the Maharashtra government will fall due to its internal fights. "This dispensation will never stand on strong legs," Raut added. "This regime will not last," he stated.

229.title: President-elect Droupadi Murmu pays homage to Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat
229.article_body: Droupadi Murmu, who will take oath as India's 15th President today, paid homage to the 'father of the nation' Mahatma Gandhi at Rajghat in the national capital. The ceremony of assumption of office will take place in Parliament's Central Hall. Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana will administer the oath of the office of the President to her.

230.title: Ghaziabad Police holds training programme for unemployed youths
230.article_body: Ghaziabad Police on Sunday initiated a training programme for imparting skills to unemployed youths. The programme titled 'Atmanirbhar training and awareness' aims to impart training to 150 selected persons in fire safety, veterinary care and training, security guards and medical care. Notably, the aim is to increase the employability of those youths who are less educated, an official said.

231.title: Iyer-Samson partnership made huge difference: Dhawan on 2nd WI ODI win
231.article_body: India captain Shikhar Dhawan praised Shreyas Iyer and Sanju Samson for their partnership during India's chase of 312 runs in the second ODI against West Indies. "We knew we could do it. We started a little slow. The Iyer-Samson partnership made a huge difference," stated Dhawan. India were 79/3 when Iyer and Samson added 99 runs for the fourth wicket.

232.title: J&K admin forcing people to participate in 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign: Mufti
232.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti raised questions over the collection of money by the Jammu and Kashmir administration for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign alleging that traders and shop owners are forced to deposit money for tricolours. The manner in which people are being forced looks like Kashmir is an "enemy territory" that needs to be captured, she said in a tweet.

233.title: Policybazaar reports IT systems breach, says 'No significant customer data exposed'
233.article_body: Insurance aggregator Policybazaar said that its IT systems were subject to illegal and unauthorised access, however, "no significant" customer data was exposed. In a regulatory filing to the exchanges, the company said that the unauthorised access was reported on July 19 and that it has also fixed the vulnerabilities identified in its IT systems.

234.title: Myanmar junta executes 4 democracy activists in first such killings in decades
234.article_body: Myanmar's military authorities have executed four democracy activists accused of helping carry out "terror acts", state media said on Monday, the nation's first executions in decades. Those executed included democracy figure Kyaw Min Yu, better known as Jimmy, former lawmaker from Aung San Suu Kyi's party and hip-hop artist Phyo Zeya Thaw, Hla Myo Aung and Aung Thura Zaw.

235.title: 2 killed, 5 injured after shooting at a public park in Los Angeles
235.article_body: At least two people were killed and five others were injured after one or more people opened fire at a public park in Los Angeles on Sunday afternoon. The shooting occurred at a car show in Peck Park in San Pedro. A spokesperson for Los Angeles Police said that they neither had a suspect in custody, nor a suspect description.

236.title: ED car carrying Bengal minister Partha’s close aide Arpita meets with accident
236.article_body: A car that was part of Enforcement Directorate's convoy ferrying West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's close aide Arpita Mukherjee to the CGO complex in Salt Lake met with accident on Sunday. News agency ANI shared pictures of incident, which show car damaged on one side. Mukherjee had been remanded to one-day ED custody in connection with the SSC scam case.

237.title: GHMC to now set up Annapurna '₹5/meal' canteens with seating facility
237.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has identified 32 locations in Hyderabad to set up 'Annapurna' canteens, which provide meals at a cost of ₹5, with seating arrangements for customers. The scheme provides a full spread of 400 grams of rice, 120 grams of sambar, 100 grams of vegetable curry and 15 grams of pickle to people.

238.title: Last few seats left for IIM-I & Jigsaw’s online Management & AI program
238.article_body: IIM Indore and Jigsaw announced that seats are filling up fast for their online Management & AI program which covers topics like Business Strategy, Building AI teams, Managerial Economics, ML, Deep Learning, Machine Vision, Conversational AI, etc. The 15-month program is ideal for aspirants with 3+ years of experience & a desire to be an AI-empowered leader, said Jigsaw.

239.title: India break Pak's world record for winning most consecutive ODI series against a team
239.article_body: India have broken the world record for winning most consecutive bilateral ODI series against a team. With their win in the second ODI against West Indies, India registered their 12th consecutive ODI series victory against West Indies. India overtook Pakistan, who held the previous world record with 11 consecutive ODI series victories against Zimbabwe.

240.title: Bar owner, employees assault 8 police personnel in Delhi's Hauz Khas, 10 held
240.article_body: Police have arrested 10 people after eight police personnel were allegedly assaulted by a bar owner and his employees during a raid in Delhi's Hauz Khas area. "We have started conducting a drive to clean up the area. There are many illegal bars and restaurants here, which attract a rowdy crowd," Deputy Commissioner of Police (Southwest), Manoj C, said.

241.title: Family quarantined, case complicated: Official on Delhi's monkeypox case
241.article_body: After Delhi's first case of monkeypox was detected, a health official said that the case is complicated as the patient has no history of foreign travel. "The patient's immediate family has been quarantined and their symptoms are being traced," the health official said. Another official said that they have been on alert since April.

242.title: Character assassination reached new level: Musk on report of dating Brin's wife
242.article_body: Responding to a report about his alleged affair with Google Co-founder Sergey Brin's wife Nicole Shanahan, the world's richest person Elon Musk said that "character assassination attacks have reached a new level this year". While Musk denied the alleged affair, he added, "I work crazy hours, so there just isn’t much time for shenanigans."

243.title: Mehmood shared incident where people threw his autograph away: Dharmendra
243.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra shared a picture of late actor Mehmood on his Instagram and recalled an incident where people came to Mehmood for his autograph at the beginning of his career. "Mehmood said...'I signed it with my name. They began looking at me in a weird way and told me...they wanted Prem Nath's autograph. They threw away mine'," Dharmendra stated.

244.title: Rajinikanth honoured by Income Tax Department, daughter Aishwarya shares pics from event
244.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth was honoured by the Income Tax Department in Chennai in recognition of his contribution towards nation building. Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwarya accepted the award at an event on behalf of him. Sharing pictures, she wrote, "Proud daughter of a high and prompt tax payer...Many thanks to...Income Tax Department of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry for honouring appa on #incometaxday2022."

245.title: Total bullshit: Elon Musk on reports of affair with Google Co-founder's wife
245.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has denied reports alleging that he had an affair last year with his longtime friend and Google Co-founder Sergey Brin's wife Nicole Shanahan. "This is total bs. Sergey and I are friends and were at a party together last night!" Musk tweeted. He further said that he's only seen Shanahan twice in three years.

246.title: India record their highest successful ODI run chase in West Indies, win series
246.article_body: India chased down a 312-run target in the second ODI against West Indies in Trinidad to record their highest successful ODI run chase in West Indies. Axar Patel finished the chase with a six and top-scored for India with 64*(35). With the victory, India took an unassailable 2-0 series lead, marking their 12th consecutive ODI series win against West Indies.

247.title: 3-year-old mauled to death by wild animal in Uttar Pradesh
247.article_body: A 3-year-old boy was mauled to death by a wild animal in Poore Matka village in Uttar Pradesh, the police said. According to the police, Saroj Devi was sleeping with her son Azad in her hut and when he disappeared, she along with her neighbours started searching for the boy. His mutilated body was found 200 metres from the hut.

248.title: Flag Code amendement a progressive move: Flag Foundation of India
248.article_body: Naveen Jindal, President of the Flag Foundation of India, called the amendment to the Flag Code of India 'progressive'. The amendment allows common citizens to hoist the flag 24 hours a day at their homes. "This amendment to the Flag Code of India will definitely encourage more and more people to display the Tiranga with dignity and pride," Jindal tweeted.

249.title: He never had alcohol, cigarettes; he was fit: Aasif on actor Deepesh Bhan's death aged 41
249.article_body: Actor Aasif Sheikh, speaking about his 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' co-star Deepesh Bhan's death aged 41, said, "He never had alcohol, cigarettes or any substance...Till now we all are in shock about how this happened." He added, "How can it happen to him, he was fit, if someone...has health issues we can still understand, but he was absolutely fine."

250.title: Congress to hold 'Satyagraha' on day Sonia appears before ED
250.article_body: The Congress party has asked its state units to organise peaceful 'Satyagraha' on July 26, the day when its president Sonia Gandhi is due to appear before the ED for questioning in the National Herald case. The party has instructed all its MPs, party General Secretaries and CWC members to be present in the 'Satyagraha' to be observed in Delhi.

251.title: Eknath Shinde to visit Maharashtra's flood-hit areas on July 30, 31
251.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde will visit flood-hit districts of Nashik, Northern Maharashtra, Marathwada and Western Maharashtra, on July 30 and 31. He said that he will also visit flood-affected villages in the state to assure the government's aid. Previously, Shinde has visited the Gadchiroli district which was badly hit by heavy rains and floods.

252.title: 2 dead, 2 injured in Pakistan due to heavy rainfall
252.article_body: Two people were reported dead and two others injured due to rain-related incidents in different parts of Pakistan on Sunday. One man died of electrocution amid a heavy downpour in Karachi, local media reported citing a police surgeon. In Peshawar, at least one person died and two others were injured due to heavy rains within 24 hours, authorities informed.

253.title: Thailand's 1st monkeypox patient escapes to Cambodia, caught
253.article_body: A Nigerian man who was on the run after being identified as Thailand's first monkeypox patient was found in Cambodia's Phnom Penh on Saturday and taken to hospital, authorities said. The tourist was diagnosed with monkeypox in Phuket last week. At least 142 people who were present at the venues he visited in Phuket are now being screened for monkeypox.

254.title: He never had alcohol, cigarettes; he was fit: Aasif on actor Deepesh Bhan's death aged 41
254.article_body: Actor Aasif Sheikh, speaking about his 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' co-star Deepesh Bhan's death aged 41, "He never had alcohol, cigarettes or any substance...Till now we all are in shock about how this happened." He added, "How can it happen to him, he was fit, if someone...has health issues we can still understand, but he was absolutely fine."

255.title: Pant's Gabba knock helped CA clinch ₹2,000-cr deal with Disney Star: Reports
255.article_body: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant's knock of 89*(138) at the Gabba in 2021 helped Cricket Australia (CA) clinch a $250-million (around ₹2,000-crore) deal with Disney Star for rights into Indian market, a report by The Sydney Morning Herald stated. "Pant's phenomenal innings to deliver India the Gabba Test & Border-Gavaskar Trophy...remained fresh in plenty of executive memories," the report stated.

256.title: Elon Musk had an affair with Google Co-founder Sergey Brin's wife last year: Report
256.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk had an affair with Nicole Shanahan, wife of his longtime friend, Google Co-founder Sergey Brin, last year, The Wall Street Journal reported. It prompted Brin to file for divorce from Nicole earlier this year, the report added. Brin also ordered his financial advisers to sell his personal investments in Musk's companies, the report said.

257.title: 65-yr-old kills his addict son, hacks his body & throws it in different places in Guj
257.article_body: A 65-year-old retired Traffic Inspector allegedly killed his 21-year-old son, hacked his body and disposed of it in different locations in Ahmedabad's Gujarat, police said. The accused, Nilesh Joshi, took the extreme step after a fight with his son who was suffering from addiction, they added. He was caught while on his way to the Nepal border via UP.

258.title: US is manufacturing biological weapons in Ukraine: North Korea
258.article_body: North Korea has accused US of manufacturing biological weapons in Ukraine, adding that the US policy is the "root cause of Ukraine crisis". This comes months after Russia made a similar claim, which was dismissed by UN. Notably, Ukraine has cut diplomatic ties with North Korea after the latter recognised the Ukrainian breakaway regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent.

259.title: I was in same situation in 2003 as Neeraj was at midway stage in Oregon: Anju
259.article_body: Following javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra's silver medal at 2022 World Championships, ex-Indian long jumper Anju Bobby George said she was in same situation at 2003 World Championships as Neeraj was at midway stage in Oregon. "He was at fourth after three rounds and I was also fourth after three rounds," she added. Anju won bronze after her fifth round jump.

260.title: 3 killed, 5 injured in factory fire in Karnataka's Hubballi
260.article_body: Three persons succumbed to their injuries on Sunday and five others are being treated for burn wounds after a sparkle candle factory in Karnataka's Hubballi caught fire on Saturday, reports said. Three of the eight victims were reported to be in critical condition on Saturday. "We are...probing for irregularities by the factory and its owner," an official said.

261.title: BJP Minority Morcha to hold Gurugram camp to discuss Lok Sabha polls
261.article_body: The Minority Morcha of the Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) is going to organise a three-day national training camp in Gurugram, Haryana. At the camp, the party will discuss the strategy for the general election with the aim to reach out to the minority community of the country. The three-day programme will be held from July 25 to July 27.

262.title: Will fix UK's broken immigration system if I become PM: Rishi Sunak
262.article_body: Ex-UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak, who's one of the two final contenders in race to become UK's PM, said that he'll fix UK's "broken" immigration system if elected. Under Sunak's 10-point plan to secure UK's borders, parliament will decide on number of refugees to be accepted yearly. Sunak needs to win in Conservative Party members' postal ballot to become PM.

263.title: Non-violent protests can continue: New Sri Lankan Prez amid unrest
263.article_body: Newly-appointed Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said that non-violent protests against the administration will be allowed to continue, his office confirmed on Sunday. This comes as security forces raided an anti-government protest camp at President's Secretariat after Wickremesinghe was sworn in as President. The raid drew condemnation from UN over the use of coercion against protesters.

264.title: Rare rainbow-coloured Sun halo seen in Dehradun, pics surface
264.article_body: A rainbow-coloured halo around the Sun was seen in Uttarakhand's Dehradun on Sunday with people sharing pictures of the rare phenomenon online. The halo appears like a rainbow encircling the Sun due to the sunlight refracting through millions of hexagonal ice crystals which are suspended in the atmosphere, said an expert.

265.title: Kovind's farewell remarks show his passion towards national progress: PM
265.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said outgoing President Ram Nath Kovind's remarks while addressing the nation on the eve of his last day in office showcase his passion towards national progress. The remarks reflect the spirit with which he served the nation as the President, PM Modi added. President-elect Droupadi Murmu will take oath as the President on Monday.

266.title: Verstappen wins F1 French GP after Leclerc crashes out from lead
266.article_body: Defending Formula One champion Red Bull's Max Verstappen won French Grand Prix on Sunday after Ferrari's Charles Leclerc crashed out while leading. Seven-time champion Lewis Hamilton finished second in his 300th GP. George Russell, Hamilton's Mercedes teammate, finished third. Leclerc's race ended on lap 18 when he lost control of his car at turn 11 and spun into the barriers.

267.title: No port, vessel related charges on coastal shipping for 6 months: Govt
267.article_body: Major ports have been directed to exempt coastal shipping operations from port and vessel charges for the next six months, an official statement said on Sunday. Ports, Shipping and Waterways Minister Sarbananda Sonowal has also asked states to lower VAT on diesel used by the shipping sector. Sonowal also requested Centre to reduce rates and taxes on fuel for ferries.

268.title: Proud of being popular among rapid-fire shows: Kartik Aaryan
268.article_body: On being asked about one thing he is extremely proud of, actor Kartik Aaryan said, "That I'm popular among rapid-fire shows." His response is being touted to be directed at filmmaker Karan Johar's talk show 'Koffee With Karan'. Ranveer Singh mimicked Kartik in the first episode and Sara Ali Khan confirmed dating him in the past in the second episode.

269.title: Sara says she loved Dhanush in 'The Gray Man', actor replies
269.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan took to Instagram Stories to congratulate her 'Atrangi Re' co-star Dhanush for his film 'The Gray Man'. Sharing a picture of them from Ritesh Sidhwani's party for the Russo Brothers, she wrote, "Had a blast catching up with my Vishu Babu." Dhanush responded to her story, writing, "It was great catching up with you my Rinku."

270.title: Xi, other top leaders received domestic COVID-19 vaccines: China
270.article_body: China on Saturday said that President Xi Jinping and other top leaders of the country have received indigenously developed COVID-19 vaccines. The leadership is "highly confident" in locally-made vaccines, a National Health Commission official said. Earlier, the government had refused to comment on Xi's vaccination status. This is the first time that such information has been publicised by China.

271.title: Don't think anybody can replace Kohli at no. 3 for some time: Rajkumar
271.article_body: Rajkumar Sharma has said no one can replace Virat Kohli at number three for some time after Shreyas Iyer replaced him at the same position in ongoing ODI series against West Indies. "But we'll have to develop youngsters at that position...it isn't necessary that only Shreyas takes over that role," he added. Kohli has been rested for West Indies series.

272.title: Uber admits covering up 2016 hacking, avoids prosecution in US settlement
272.article_body: Uber on Friday accepted that its personnel failed to report a data breach that affected 57 million passengers and drivers in 2016, as part of a settlement with US prosecutors to avoid criminal charges. Uber waited about a year to report the breach, said US Attorney Stephanie Hinds. Uber is also cooperating with former security officer Joseph Sullivan's prosecution.

273.title: UP woman found buried by riverbank after being missing for weeks
273.article_body: A 22-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh was found buried by a riverbank after being reported missing close to two weeks ago, the police said. A resident of the Kanshiram colony, the woman had gone missing on July 12. Her body was exhumed and sent for post-mortem and the police are currently investigating the matter.

274.title: India ruled 1 over short of target in 1st ODI vs WI, players fined 20% of match fee
274.article_body: Team India players have been fined 20% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against West Indies in the first ODI in Trinidad. The sanctions were imposed by match referee Richie Richardson, who ruled Shikhar Dhawan's side to be one over short of the target. India won the first ODI by three runs.

275.title: Kohli congratulates Neeraj Chopra on winning historic medal, says 'We are proud of you'
275.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli took to Twitter to congratulate javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra on becoming the first Indian athlete to win a silver medal at the World Athletics Championships. Kohli wrote, "Congratulations @Neeraj_chopra1 on winning the silver at the World Athletics Championships. We are proud of you." Neeraj won the medal with a best throw of 88.13 metres.

276.title: I had to say the truth: Kate Moss on supporting Johnny in defamation trial
276.article_body: Speaking about supporting ex-boyfriend Johnny Depp in his defamation case against Amber Heard, model Kate Moss said that she had to say the truth. "I know the truth about Johnny. I know he never kicked me down the stairs," she said. Kate and Johnny dated between 1994 and 1998. Johnny won the case against Amber and was awarded $10 million.

277.title: Pics of Deepak Hooda wearing Prasidh Krishna's jersey in 2nd ODI go viral, fans react
277.article_body: Several fans spotted Team India's Deepak Hooda wearing Prasidh Krishna's jersey in the second ODI against West Indies. Reacting to it, a fan joked, "Why is Hooda wearing Prasidh's jersey? Is the budget low?" Another fan jokingly tweeted, "Krunal Pandya wore 24 for India and now Hooda is also wearing 24. Pure bond."

278.title: What's the significance of July 25 in the history of Presidents of India?
278.article_body: President-elect Droupadi Murmu will take oath as the first tribal woman President of India on Monday, July 25. The date is historically significant because almost all Indian Presidents took oath on July 25 even without any written rule about it. The four Presidents who are exceptions to this trend are- Rajendra Prasad, Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, Zakir Husain and Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed.

279.title: First look of Big B, Rashmika Mandanna, Neena Gupta's 'GoodBye' released
279.article_body: The first look of Amitabh Bachchan, Rashmika Mandanna and Neena Gupta's upcoming film 'GoodBye' was released on Saturday. The film, which also features Pavail Gulati, Elli AvrRam, Sunil Grover and Sahil Mehta, will mark Rashmika's Bollywood debut. The still from 'GoodBye' shows Amitabh and Rashmika sharing a bowl of popcorn while their family sits on a carpet watching a match.

280.title: No country as fortunate as India to have galaxy of leaders in small span: Kovind
280.article_body: Outgoing President Ram Nath Kovind on Sunday addressed the nation on the eve of his last day in office. He said, "I've always strongly believed that no other country has been as fortunate as India in having a galaxy of leaders, each of whom was an exceptional mind, within a span of a few decades in the early twentieth century."

281.title: Israeli agents planning sabotage and terror ops caught, claims Iran
281.article_body: Iranian forces on Saturday preemptively arrested a network of agents with links to Israel before they could execute sabotage and "terrorist operations", state media reported. "This network's members were in contact with Mossad spy agency through a neighbouring country and entered Iran from (Iraq's) Kurdistan...with advanced equipment and strong explosives," Iran's Intelligence Ministry stated.

282.title: AAP replaced 'happiness classes' with 'glasses': BJP on Delhi's liquor policy
282.article_body: Speaking about Delhi government's liquor policy, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Sunday stated that the ruling AAP has replaced the 'happiness classes' model with 'happiness glasses'. "Kejriwal liquor model can be explained as 'ABCD' where A stands for advertising, B for bahane baazi and blame game, C for corruption and cover-up and D for deviation or diversion," Poonawalla stated.

283.title: BJP top brass to decide if my son will contest from Shikaripura: BSY
283.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa (BSY) said that PM Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and JP Nadda will decide if his son would contest from the Shikaripura constituency. Earlier, Yediyurappa said that he wouldn't contest from the constituency and asked people to support his son BY Vijayendra. The decision of BJP leaders is final in this matter, BSY said.

284.title: 16-yr-old girl stabs differently-abled man to death in Chhattisgarh
284.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly stabbed a differently-abled man to death in an incident of road rage in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Sunday, police said. The minor, who was riding a two-wheeler, attacked the deaf-mute victim, who was on his bicycle, after he didn't respond to her horn. She allegedly stabbed the man's neck with a knife, killing him on the spot.

285.title: Rights group seeks arrest of ex-Sri Lankan President in Singapore
285.article_body: A rights group has filed a criminal complaint with Singapore's attorney general, seeking arrest of ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa over his alleged role in Sri Lankan civil war. The International Truth and Justice Project said that Rajapaksa breached Geneva Conventions during war when he served as country's defence chief. Rajapaksa is currently in Singapore on a short-term visit pass.

286.title: Massive star system with 3 Suns found for the first time in deep space
286.article_body: Scientists at the Niels Bohr Institute at the University of Copenhagen recently announced the discovery of a massive triple-star system or a system with three Suns. The system, which is the first of its kind, has two Suns that orbit one another and a third more massive Sun orbiting the pair. The stars in the system are very close together.

287.title: Massive sandstorm hits parts of China, causes darkness in towns; pics go viral
287.article_body: Pictures and videos have gone viral on social media showing massive sandstorm hitting parts of China and causing darkness in towns. In the pictures, sandstorm can be seen enveloping buildings and cars and blocking the sun. In some towns of Qinghai province, visibility dropped to less than 200 metres, South China Morning Post reported.

288.title: Top seed Ruud snaps Berrettini's winning streak to defend title in Gstaad
288.article_body: Top seed Casper Ruud defeated second seed Matteo Berrettini 4-6, 7-6(7-4), 6-2 to defend the title at EFG Swiss Open Gstaad on Sunday. The Norwegian snapped Berrettini's 12-match winning streak in the final. "I changed [things] up a little bit in...third set especially, which helped," said Ruud. Notably, this is Ruud's fourth consecutive title at ATP Tour events in Switzerland.

289.title: I used to be shy, beating boys brought me confidence: US Open champ Raducanu
289.article_body: Reflecting on her tennis journey so far, 19-year-old Emma Raducanu said she used to be shy as a young girl, playing tennis and beating the boys brought her a lot of confidence. "Yeah, I can say that I'm definitely more comfortable and outgoing now," she added. Raducanu became the first-ever qualifier to win a Grand Slam at 2021 US Open.

290.title: Nature in agony, climate crisis can endanger planet's future: Prez Kovind
290.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, on the eve of demitting office, said on Sunday that Mother Nature is in deep agony and the climate crisis can endanger the planet's future. He said that we must protect the environment for the sake of our children. "As the first citizen, if I have to give one advice...it has to be this," he said.

291.title: Infosys' profit rises 3.2% to ₹5,360 crore y-o-y, revenue jumps 23.6% to ₹34,470 crore
291.article_body: Infosys, India's second largest IT services provider, on Sunday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹5,360 crore for the first quarter, up 3.2% year-on-year from ₹5,195 crore recorded in Q1FY22. The IT major's consolidated revenue stood at ₹34,470 crore, up 23.6% from ₹27,896 crore recorded during the same quarter of the previous fiscal year.

292.title: Infosys hired 21,171 people in first quarter, headcount rose to 3,35,186
292.article_body: Infosys, India's second largest IT services provider, hired 21,171 people the first quarter of FY23, the company said while announcing its results for Q1 today. The company's headcount was 3,35,186 as of June 30, up from 3,14,015 last quarter. Infosys reported a consolidated net profit of ₹5,360 crore for the first quarter ended June 2022.

293.title: Getting equipped to make 21st century the century of India: President Kovind
293.article_body: As part of his address to the nation on the eve of his last day in office, President Ram Nath Kovind said that our country is getting equipped to make the 21st century the century of India. He further said that once education and healthcare are in place, economic reforms will let citizens find the best course for their lives.

294.title: Biden doing well, likely infected with BA.5 variant: White House
294.article_body: US President Joe Biden's health is improving after testing positive for COVID-19 on Thursday, White House COVID coordinator Ashish Jha said on Sunday. Biden has likely been infected with the BA.5 variant of COVID-19, Jha told the media. The official added that none of Biden's close contacts tested positive for the virus.

295.title: For what?: Cong leader's reply to Smriti Irani's notice amid 'illegal' bar row
295.article_body: Congress Spokesperson Shama Mohamed has demanded Union Minister Smriti Irani's apology "for allegedly manipulating licenses" in "illegal bar" row. This comes after Irani sent a legal notice to Congress and its three leaders for alleging her daughter ran an "illegal" bar in Goa. "For what? There's ample proof that her daughter was running the restaurant," Mohamed said regarding Irani's notice.

296.title: I salute the power of India's vibrant democracy: President Kovind
296.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind said that he salutes the power of the vibrant democratic system of our country. "Ram Nath Kovind, who grew up in a very ordinary family in Paraunkh village of Kanpur Dehat district, is addressing all of you countrymen today," he said. This was part of his address on the eve of his last day in office.

297.title: India will emerge victorious in case of any war: Rajnath Singh
297.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday expressed confidence that India will emerge victorious in case of any war and is well-equipped to give a befitting reply to "anyone who casts an evil eye". Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir is a part of India and will continue to remain so, Singh said. "India has become a strong and confident nation," he added.

298.title: Russia says it destroyed a Ukrainian warship near Odessa
298.article_body: Russia on Sunday said that its missiles destroyed a Ukrainian warship at the Odessa port on Saturday. This comes a day after Moscow reportedly denied attacking it. Ukraine had accused Russia of targeting Odessa grain stocks a day after the signing of an agreement between the two countries for the resumption of Ukrainian grain exports from Black Sea ports.

299.title: Nadal has something that makes you suffer more on court than others: Robredo
299.article_body: Former world number five Tommy Robredo said Rafael Nadal was his toughest opponent on court because of his Spanish compatriot's style of play. "I don't say the others are easy...but for me Rafa had something that makes you suffer more inside the court than the rest," he added. Robredo lost all the seven matches he played against Nadal.

300.title: Uddhav Thackeray didn't give enough time to MLAs: Rebel Sena MLA
300.article_body: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Gulabrao Patil alleged that party chief and former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray did not give enough time to MLAs during his tenure as the CM. Patil said Thackeray should get rid of the coterie of party leaders around him. He added, "When Thackeray was just the party head, we could raise our complaints against a minister."

301.title: Secure future of students who returned from Ukraine: TN CM tells PM
301.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin has written to PM Narendra Modi, requesting Centre to secure the future of medical students who returned from Ukraine. "[Tamil Nadu] has been...urging you...to accommodate [them] in India or in...universities abroad," he wrote. Centre recently told Lok Sabha there's no permission from National Medical Commission to accommodate Ukraine-returned students in local colleges.

302.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad acquires Harappa Education for ₹300 crore
302.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad announced 100% acquisition of Harappa Education for ₹300 crore. upGrad and Harappa shareholders Bodhi Tree Systems, along with Co-Founders Pramath Raj Sinha and Shreyasi Singh closed the transaction. Harappa's Co-founders will join the upGrad Cap table. Online learning platform Harappa Education has an active clientele of 100 mid and large-sized organisations.

303.title: 2 Palestinian militants killed by Israeli forces in West Bank
303.article_body: Two suspected Palestinian militants were killed during an early morning raid at a house in West Bank's Nablus by Israeli forces on Sunday. Israel Police said that its personnel opened retaliatory fire after coming under attack by the gunmen while searching for a wanted suspect. The Fatah Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades militant group has claimed the slain Palestinians as its members.

304.title: Tech Mahindra, Mahindra University to set up lab for Metaverse
304.article_body: Tech Mahindra and Mahindra University signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to set up a Makers Lab for research and development in quantum computing, explainable Artificial Intelligence and Metaverse. The lab, to be established in Hyderabad, will be the 11th facility globally. Mahindra University Vice Chancellor Yajulu Medury said that the MoU is an academia-industry collaboration.

305.title: Cong leader moves SC against linking Aadhaar to Voter ID, hearing on Monday
305.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear a petition against the Centre's June 19 notification linking Aadhaar and Voter ID cards on Monday. The petition was moved by Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala citing a violation of the right to privacy and right to equality. Surjewala has stated that the law is unconstitutional and ultra vires the Constitution.

306.title: Cochin Shipyard, IIM-K sign agreement to boost maritime startups
306.article_body: Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) and Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode have signed an agreement to boost startups in the maritime sector. CSL and IIM-K's business incubator Laboratory for Innovation Venturing and Entrepreneurship (LIVE) will support the startups from the technical, regulatory, financial, and marketing points of view. CSL said startups can get up to ₹50 lakh as seed grants.

307.title: Italian govt may acquire 20% stake in Titagarh Wagons subsidiary
307.article_body: Invitalia, the Italian government's investment promotion agency is likely to acquire 20% stake in Titagarh Wagons’ wholly-owned subsidiary Firema SPA. After Titagarh Group were suffering financially during the pandemic, they were in dialogue with the Italian government for capital support. Firema is executing railway projects in Europe and built India’s first aluminium coach for Pune Metro.

308.title: Will cherish the times when met armed forces' jawans: Prez Kovind
308.article_body: Outgoing President Ram Nath Kovind on the eve of demitting office on Sunday said he will especially cherish the occasions when he got an opportunity to meet brave jawans of the armed forces, para-military forces and the police. "Their patriotic zeal is as amazing as it is inspiring," he said. He addressed the nation before demitting office.

309.title: Venture capital firm Auxano Capital launches $25 million fund
309.article_body: Early-stage venture capital firm Auxano Capital has launched a $25 million fund through its network of high net-worth individuals, ultra high net-worth individuals and family offices. The firm is expecting its first close of this by the end of July-September quarter. The firm, founded in 2016, is looking to invest in startups across fintech, enterprise SaaS, sustainable mobility and agritech.

310.title: Olympic champion Pichardo wins 1st World C'ships gold in men's triple jump
310.article_body: Portugal's Pedro Pichardo won his first World Championships gold medal in men's triple jump on Saturday, adding to his Olympic gold from Tokyo. The 29-year-old jumped a world-leading 17.95 metres on his first attempt to take the top spot. Pichardo, a two-time world silver medallist for Cuba before switching allegiance to Portugal, said, "This world title was elusive to me."

311.title: 18-year-old migrant labourer killed by lions in Gujarat's Amreli
311.article_body: An 18-year-old migrant labourer from Madhya Pradesh was killed after a pair of lions attacked him and his family while returning to their farm on Saturday evening in Gujarat's Amreli. Officials said that the lion and lioness attacked him from behind, killing him on the spot. Only his body parts have been recovered suggesting the lions ate him, officials said.

312.title: Got threats after 'Kashmir Files', can't go out or meet my own family: Agnihotri
312.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri on Saturday claimed he faced threats over his film, adding, "I can't go out. I am a social person." Agnihotri said, "I can't meet my own family. All my movement is restricted...this is so unfortunate." He added, "Imagine, (Steven) Spielberg getting...threats after making [Schindler's List]. It never happened."

313.title: It was traumatic, I'm the first in my family to get arrested: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja
313.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja (Flying Beast) opened up about his arrest earlier this month over stampede-like situation at a Noida metro station after thousands gathered to celebrate his birthday. "It was extremely traumatic...I'm the first in the family to...get arrested...When I was taken to police station...I was asked...why I broke the law. I was clueless...I had no information," he said.

314.title: President Ram Nath Kovind addresses the nation on last day in office
314.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind addressed the nation on the eve of his last day in office on Sunday. He said, "I was elected as the President through your (the citizens') elected people's representatives...I want to express my heartfelt gratitude to all of you and your public representatives." President-elect Droupadi Murmu will take oath as the President on Monday.

315.title: Vicky does Zoom call with fan page admins to mark 7 years of 'Masaan'
315.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram Stories on Sunday to share a picture of himself while he was on a Zoom call with the admins of his fan pages to celebrate seven years of his film 'Masaan'. He wrote alongside the picture, "Zoom call with fanpage admins and it really made my day. Thank you I love you so much."

316.title: 120-km long 'sideways' skyscraper to be built for $1 trillion in Saudi Arabia
316.article_body: Saudi Arabia is planning to build a $1 trillion sideways skyscraper stretching over 120 km, which will house five million people, a report by the Wall Street Journal has said. Pictures of what the mirrored skyscraper called 'Mirror Line' will look like have also been shared online. It will have a suspended sports complex, a marina to moor yachts etc.

317.title: How does the World Championships 2022 medal tally read as India clinch their 1st medal?
317.article_body: India bagged their first medal at the World Athletics Championships 2022 on the second-last day, with Neeraj Chopra clinching silver in javelin throw. As many as 41 nations have bagged at least one medal. India are joint 28th on the medal standings. The medal tally is led by US, who have bagged 10 gold, eight silver and 10 bronze medals.

318.title: Actress Arpita, aide of WB minister Partha, sent to 1-day ED custody
318.article_body: West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee's close aide and actress Arpita Mukherjee was on Sunday sent to Enforcement Directorate (ED) custody for one day in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam in the state. She will be produced before the special court on Monday. ED arrested her on Saturday after recovering ₹20 crore from her residence during raids.

319.title: Olympic champion Warner out of decathlon after injury at World C'ships
319.article_body: Tokyo Olympics gold medallist Damian Warner has withdrawn from decathlon event at World Athletics Championships after sustaining an injury during 400 metres, which was the final event of day one. The Canadian was leading the competition when he pulled up with what appeared to be a hamstring injury and fell on the track. Ayden Owens-Delerme is currently the overall leader.

320.title: K'taka Cong to observe 'Mauna Satyagraha' on Tue over ED questioning Sonia
320.article_body: Karnataka Congress will observe 'Mauna Satyagraha' (silent resistence) on Tuesday as party leader Sonia Gandhi appears before the Enforcement Directorate for questioning in the National Herald case, state unit president DK Shivakumar said. Satyagraha will be organised for the entire duration of Gandhi's questioning. All MPs, MLAs, AICC office-bearers, councillors will take part in the Satyagraha.

321.title: Crowd protests outside police station over 26-yr-old kabaddi player's murder
321.article_body: A crowd gathered outside Mumbai's Dharavi police station on Sunday demanding the arrest of all accused in the murder case of 26-year-old kabaddi player identified as Vimalraj Nadar. Three persons have been apprehended so far while three accused are yet to be arrested. Vimalraj was bludgeoned to death with a cricket stump on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday.

322.title: Delhi schools complain against PWD for using poor infra material
322.article_body: Several Delhi government schools have filed complaints against the Public Works Department (PWD), accusing it of using low-quality material for construction of school infrastructure. Schools have also complained about fire safety hazards and seepage concerns. "We're looking into...complaints raised by the schools...We'll take strict action against the [concerned] contractors," a PWD official said.

323.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against West Indies
323.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bat first against India in the second ODI in Trinidad. India have made one change to their playing XI, with 25-year-old fast bowler Avesh Khan replacing Prasidh Krishna. Avesh, who made his T20I debut earlier this year, is playing his first-ever ODI for India.

324.title: 9 girls, 9 boys top ISC Class 12 exam with 399/400 marks, list released
324.article_body: As many as 18 students, including nine boys and nine girls, jointly secured the All India Rank 1 in ISC Class 12 examinations. The 18 students got 399/400 marks (99.75%). Out of the 18 students, seven are from Uttar Pradesh, six from West Bengal, three from Tamil Nadu and one each from Maharashtra and Haryana.

325.title: Man stabs younger brother in Hyderabad over property dispute
325.article_body: A scuffle between two brothers due to a property dispute turned violent when the older brother stabbed the younger one with a paper-cutter in Hyderabad on Saturday. The incident reportedly took place in Chatta Bazar when 29-year-old Mohammad Masiuddin and 32-year-old Mohammad Akbaruddin got into an argument regarding their property. Masiuddin has been hospitalised while Akbaruddin is absconding.

326.title: ANPR cameras help B'luru Traffic Police collect ₹21 cr in fines
326.article_body: In Bengaluru, Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) cameras helped traffic police track down violators in 3.9 lakh active cases and collect fines worth over ₹21 crore from them till July 19. The cameras were installed on March 1 at several crossings, most of them near the Central Business District. ANPR cameras helped in collection of fines in 2,765 cases daily.

327.title: 11 arrested for gambling after raid on TDP leader's house in Hyd
327.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday reportedly raided the house of Andhra Pradesh TDP leader Ravi Kumar Varma in the city and arrested 11 persons for gambling. Varma himself was not arrested as he was not playing cards, reports suggest. Police reportedly seized cash worth ₹19.5 lakhs. It is learned that those arrested include realtors and businessmen from Hyderabad and Andhra Pradesh.

328.title: Traffic advisory issued in Delhi ahead of Prez-elect's swearing-in ceremony
328.article_body: Vehicular movement is likely to be affected in Lutyens' Delhi on Monday due to President-elect Droupadi Murmu's swearing-in ceremony, Delhi Traffic Police said. Commuters have been asked to avoid Teen Murti Marg, Akbar Road, Krishna Menon Marg and Maulana Azad Road, among others, between 9:00 am and 12 noon. New Parliament building's construction will also be stopped during this time.

329.title: BBMP chief inspects development works at Silk Board Junction
329.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath on Saturday inspected the ongoing development works at the Silk Board Junction where BMRCL is fixing a bus stop. He instructed officials to direct the flow of water to nearby drains to avoid stagnation. He further asked officials to speed up the taring process to ease traffic congestion.

330.title: 3, including ex-mayor, killed in shooting at Philippine university
330.article_body: At least three people were killed in a shooting at the Ateneo de Manila University in the Philippines' Manila on Sunday, police said. The deceased include a former mayor, Rose Furigay, from the country's southern province of Basilan, who was at the university premises to attend her daughter's graduation ceremony. The incident appears to be a targeted assassination, officials said.

331.title: Chess-playing robot breaks 7-yr-old's finger at Russian tournament, video surfaces
331.article_body: A chess-playing robot broke the index finger of a seven-year-old boy who was competing at the Moscow Chess Open Tournament. A video of the incident, which took place on July 19, has also surfaced online. The robot reportedly attacked the child named Christopher after he played a move without waiting his turn, after which bystanders rushed to rescue him.

332.title: Before-after satellite pics show impact of record-breaking heatwave on UK
332.article_body: Satellite images captured by NASA show the impact record-breaking heatwave has had on the UK. In comparison to a green landscape from a year ago, the images now show the country looking dried out and brown. Earlier this week, the temperatures reached 40°C for the first time in the UK.

333.title: Portraits of PM Modi, UP CM Adityanath found in garbage at power plant
333.article_body: Portraits of PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath were found in garbage collected at Kosi Kalan power plant, officials said. Some employees of the power plant disposed of the portraits while the office was being cleaned, officials added. Recently, a sanitation worker was terminated after photos of PM Modi and Adityanath were found in his garbage cart.

334.title: 4 killed, 4 injured after car fell into gorge in J&K's Ramban
334.article_body: Four people were killed and four others got injured after a car skidded off the road and fell into a 1,000 feet deep gorge in the Ramban district, Jammu and Kashmir. The deceased were identified as Haza Begum, Abdul Rasheed, Mushtaq Ahmed and Zahida Begum, officials said. All four deceased were locals and were going from Neel to Shagan village.

335.title: Delhi man gets fake link to activate credit card, loses ₹3.5 lakh
335.article_body: At least five persons have been arrested for allegedly cheating a man in Delhi by sending him a fake link on pretext of activating his credit card. One of the accused posed as a customer care executive of a bank and contacted man. The man allegedly lost amount as soon as he filled in requested details after clicking on link.

336.title: Man dresses up as 'Yamaraja' to protest against bad roads in B'luru
336.article_body: A man dressed up as 'Yamaraja' on the Anjanapura road in Bengaluru to protest against potholed roads in the city. The man, associated with the Changemakers of Kanakapura Road, alleged that officials have been ignoring the roads of Anjanapura for more than 10 years. The organisation said these damaged roads have become a deathtrap for the daily commuters.

337.title: Irani sends legal notice to Congress leaders for claiming her daughter ran 'illegal bar'
337.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Sunday sent legal notices to the Congress party and three of its leaders over their allegations against her 18-year-old daughter Zoish. Pawan Khera, Jairam Ramesh and Netta D'Souza received notices from Irani who refuted claims that her daughter ran an "illegal bar" in Goa. She sought a written unconditional apology and withdrawal of allegations.

338.title: You are a true champion: President Kovind to Neeraj on winning silver
338.article_body: Praising javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra after he won India's first-ever silver medal at World Athletics Championships, President Ram Nath Kovind tweeted, "Neeraj continues to bring laurels and make the country proud...you're a true champion!" BCCI Secretary Jay Shah tweeted, "Congratulations Neeraj...you are writing a new course of history for Indian athletics, while inspiring millions!"

339.title: PWP workers protest outside CIDCO over inadequate water in Navi Mumbai
339.article_body: Workers of Peasants and Workers Party (PWP) staged a protest outside the City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO) office in Navi Mumbai's Kamothe over inadequate water supply. The workers also put a garland of shoes on CIDCO's water department notice board. "There is good rain everywhere [but] citizens have to bear water shortage in Kamothe," said city president Amol Shitole.

340.title: Sun Pharma, Glenmark recall products in US over manufacturing issues
340.article_body: Mumbai-headquartered drug makers Sun Pharma and Glenmark are recalling products in the US due to lapses in their manufacturing processes, as per a latest enforcement report by US Food and Drug Administration. The report states that Sun Pharma is recalling 50,680 vials of Testosterone Cypionate Injection and Glenmark is recalling 98,307 packs of a medication used for treating skin conditions.

341.title: Will give my best in CWG: Neeraj after historic silver win at World C'ships
341.article_body: Neeraj Chopra said he will give his best in the upcoming Commonwealth Games in Birmingham after becoming the second Indian and first male track and field athlete to win a medal at World Athletics Championships. Neeraj threw the javelin at a distance of 88.13 metres in his fourth attempt to win India's first-ever silver medal in the tournament.

342.title: MP records highest tiger deaths this year, Maharashtra on second
342.article_body: As many as 27 tigers died in Madhya Pradesh this year till July 15, which is the highest number of tiger deaths reported by an Indian state, according to National Tiger Conservation Authority's (NTCA) data. Total 74 tiger deaths were registered in the country during the period, as per the data. Maharashtra reported 15 tiger deaths, which is the second-highest.

343.title: Results of ISC Class 12 exams 2022 declared
343.article_body: The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) has announced the results of ISC Class 12 exams 2022. Students who appeared for the exams can check results at the official website www.cisce.org or through SMS. Schools can check the results by logging in to the CAREERS portal of the council using the school principal's login ID and password.

344.title: Introspection needed by media: Anurag Thakur after CJI's remark
344.article_body: After CJI NV Ramana said media is running "kangaroo courts", Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday called for introspection by media houses. "We need to introspect whether we have crossed the 'Lakshman Rekha' while delivering news," Thakur added. "I wish to urge friends in media that if such an impression is being created, there's a need for introspection," he stated.

345.title: Can't sit back & say we don't have numbers: Oppn VP candidate Alva
345.article_body: Opposition's Vice Presidential candidate Margaret Alva has said that while there's disunity among non-BJP parties over her nomination, she doesn't feel perturbed as the final tally of votes can always swing. "We can't just sit back and say we don't have the numbers, so we won't fight...election," she added. TMC has decided to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential elections.

346.title: Gang from Madhya Pradesh held for sandalwood theft in Pune
346.article_body: A gang has been nabbed from Madhya Pradesh for its alleged involvement in sandalwood theft at several places in Pune. Four members of the gang were arrested during an investigation into the series of sandalwood theft at sensitive locations in Khadki. They were allegedly planning to commit a robbery, police said.
