347.title: FPIs invest net ₹1,099 cr from July 1-22, break 9-month selling streak
347.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) invested net ₹1,099 crore in Indian equities between July 1-22 and broke their nine-month long selling streak, data with depositories showed. This comes after FPIs withdrew net ₹50,145 crore from equities in June, the highest net outflow since March 2020. So far this year, FPIs have pulled out around ₹2.16 lakh crore from equities.

348.title: Happy for Peters for winning gold, I'm happy with the rivalry: Neeraj Chopra
348.article_body: Praising Grenada's Anderson Peters, who won gold in the men's javelin event at the World Athletics Championships 2022, Neeraj Chopra said he's happy to have "healthy competition". "Peters is doing well, he's thrown more than 90m quite a few times this year. It's good for the sport. I'm happy with the rivalry," he added. Neeraj secured silver in the event.

349.title: Uzbek girls trafficked on bikes from Nepal: Delhi Police on prostitution racket
349.article_body: The Delhi Police, which busted a prostitution racket in South Delhi's Malviya Nagar area run by foreigners, found that the gang trafficked girls from Uzbekistan and neighbouring countries illegally on bikes across the Nepal-India border. "Most of the girls...were first brought to Nepal by flight...Then they used to cross the border wearing a burqa," the police said.

350.title: 2 teenagers drown in pond in village near Jaipur; 3 others rescued
350.article_body: Two teenagers drowned while taking bath in a pond in Aakda village located on the outskirts of Jaipur, Rajasthan. The two deceased, Rohit Bunkar (14) and Manish Gupta (14), drowned while three others were rescued by the locals, a sub-inspector of the Daulatpura police station said. Notably, the deceased were residents of the nearby Vishwakarma Industrial Area, he added.

351.title: 6 killed as house collapses after firecracker explosion in Bihar; many feared trapped
351.article_body: At least six people died after a house where an illegal firecracker unit was being run collapsed due to a blast in Bihar's Chapra on Sunday, police said. Efforts are being made to rescue people trapped under the debris. "We're investigating the reason behind the explosion. A forensic team and bomb disposal squads have also been called," he added.

352.title: Had a health issue where I couldn't move my right hand at all: Bhagyashree
352.article_body: Bhagyashree revealed that there was a time in her life when she couldn't move her right hand "at all". "I'd a major health issue...I went through immense pain," she said, adding, "That one year...I couldn't even brush...teeth or comb...hair." "Now when I think of those days when I fought to get my hand back to movement, I...get inspired," said Bhagyashree.

353.title: Can't guarantee we'll be ready in 2 weeks: Chelsea manager Tuchel
353.article_body: Following their 4-0 defeat against Arsenal in their pre-season game, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said he can't guarantee that they'll be ready for their Premier League opener against Everton on August 6. "I don't know if I ever lost 4-0 in pre-season," stated Tuchel. Chelsea also lost to Major League Soccer team Charlotte FC in their previous pre-season friendly.

354.title: I feel for Shreyas Iyer, we used to talk about him as future captain: Ajay Jadeja
354.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said he feels for Shreyas Iyer, who "walked into the team with so much promise". "A year ago we would be talking about him as the future captain...suddenly, he [starts getting] out to short balls...[and] that's playing so much on his mind that you saw that in [his] innings [against West Indies]," stated Jadeja.

355.title: 30 injured as bus turns on its side in Maharashtra's Solapur
355.article_body: A Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation bus carrying 42 passengers turned on its side after hitting the roadside curb in Maharashtra's Solapur on Sunday. Around 30 passengers sustained injuries ranging from minor to fractures and are receiving treatment, officials said. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde announced ₹50,000 aid from CM Relief Fund to those who sustained specific serious injuries.

356.title: Akshay Kumar receives 'Taxpayers Award' from govt, pic surfaces
356.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has received 'Taxpayers Award' from the government in recognition of his contribution towards nation building. A picture of the award has surfaced online. "He has the maximum number of films today and he is ruling the endorsement world. It's no surprise for him to feature in the highest tax payer list of India," a source told Pinkvilla.

357.title: Spoke to Pak's Arshad after World Championships, told him he did very well: Neeraj
357.article_body: Javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said he spoke to his competitor, Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem, after the end of the World Athletics Championships in which Chopra won a silver medal. "I told him (Nadeem) that he did very well. He replied that he had issues with his elbow," said 24-year-old Chopra, adding, "It was a great comeback from his injury."

358.title: Felt something on thigh after silver-winning throw, will know the status tomorrow: Neeraj
358.article_body: Javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first Indian to win a silver medal at the World Athletics Championships, revealed that he felt something on his thigh after his silver-winning 88.13-metre throw in the fourth attempt. "I couldn't do my best in next two [attempts]. I had strapping [on my thigh]. I will know the status tomorrow morning," he stated.

359.title: DGCA begins special audit of airlines after surge in technical issues
359.article_body: The DGCA has started a two-month-long special audit of airlines after several technical malfunction incidents took place in planes during the last 45 days. The audit will focus on facilities like hangars, equipment being used by airline personnel, airlines' quality assurance system, duty time limitations and airlines' maintenance control centre, among others.

360.title: I don't always invest to make money, sometimes it's to help someone: Mark Cuban
360.article_body: Billionaire investor and Shark Tank judge Mark Cuban said that he doesn't do the TV show to "get the best investments". He tweeted, "I don't always invest because I think I'll make money. Sometimes my deals are purely to help someone." Cuban recently revealed that he has not profited from the investments made on the show, saying, "I've gotten beat."

361.title: Doesn't make sense to call me South actor, we're actors from India: Dhanush
361.article_body: National Award-winning actor Dhanush has said people should not attach regional identities to actors. "Every film is for everybody, especially with the digital platforms. Now everybody has easy access to watch everybody's work," he added. "So, it just doesn't make sense in these times to call me or anybody else a South actor. We're just actors from India," said Dhanush.

362.title: Keep winning medals for India like this: Bajrang on Neeraj's Worlds silver
362.article_body: Congratulating Neeraj Chopra on his silver medal in men's javelin throw at World Championships in Oregon, wrestler Bajrang Punia took to Twitter and wrote, "Brother...you keep winning medals for the country like this. This is a prayer to god." Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Unstoppable in every sense of the word, well done Neeraj! Keep scripting history with...javelin in your hand!"

363.title: This is harassment: DK Shivakumar on ED summon to Sonia Gandhi
363.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar said ED has summoned party’s interim chief Sonia Gandhi which was "unnecessary". "After fifty hours of interrogation of Rahul Gandhi, the ED has now summoned Sonia Gandhi…This is harassment. We would be observing a peaceful protest on the 26th [July]," he added. ED has issued fresh summon to Sonia Gandhi for July 26, reports stated.

364.title: This is not our road: Arjun Kapoor to paparazzi clicking pics on road
364.article_body: A video going viral shows actor Arjun Kapoor asking paparazzi clicking his pictures on the road to move inside. He can be heard saying, "Humari road nahi hai yeh. Aap log yeh karte ho aur naam humara kharab hota hai...Kisi ko lag jayegi (This is not our road. You guys do such things and we get blamed...Someone will get hurt)."

365.title: Where does WB govt want to take youth of state?: Pradhan on Partha's arrest
365.article_body: Following the arrest of West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan asked, "Where does the state government want to take the youth of Bengal?" Furthermore, he said, "₹21 crore cash was found at his residence. He is arrested and he is a minister, this shows the condition of Bengal today. This is a serious matter."

366.title: One of the reasons for our success is my 12-yr market experience: Zerodha CEO
366.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath said one of the reasons for the success of his firm is his 12-year experience in the stock market before starting the stock brokerage platform. Sharing advice for budding entrepreneurs, Kamath said that before building a business, they must find a skill they're competent in, learn it and get good at it and then monetise it.

367.title: PMC issues 758 notices to buildings in July over mosquito breeding
367.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has issued 758 notices to buildings in the city over mosquito breeding grounds, which may lead to a surge in dengue and chikungunya cases. "PMC has issued notification to the public to check [for] stagnant water around residential [and] commercial complexes," an official said. Pune has reported 50 new dengue cases this month so far.

368.title: Nehru's intentions could be good but same doesn't apply to policies: Rajnath
368.article_body: During an event to pay homage to the martyrs of the 1999 Kargil War, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh commented on the 1962 India-China War when Jawaharlal Nehru was India's Prime Minister. "In 1962, China captured our area in Ladakh. I will not question  Nehru's intentions. It can be good but the same does not apply to policies," Rajnath said.

369.title: Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal's salary falls nearly 5% to ₹15.39 crore in FY22
369.article_body: Bharti Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal's salary fell nearly 5% in the financial year 2021-22 to ₹15.39 crore. In the year 2020-21, Mittal's gross remuneration stood at ₹16.19 crore. In 2021-22, Mittal's perquisites stood at ₹83 lakh, against ₹1.62 crore in the previous fiscal. Meanwhile, Bharti Airtel MD Gopal Vittal's salary rose 5.8% in FY22 to ₹15.25 crore.

370.title: US women pull off upset, beat Jamaican team to win 4x100 relay at World C'ships
370.article_body: US women's team pulled an upset over the Jamaican team to secure the gold medal in the 4x100m relay at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon. The Jamaican team, which included both the world 100m and 200m champions, finished a close second in 41.18 seconds. The US team clocked 41.14 seconds, the fifth-fastest in history, to win the gold.

371.title: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess to step down, Porsche CEO to succeed him
371.article_body: Herbert Diess, the Volkswagen CEO who was caught up in the automaker's emissions-cheating scandal, will step down "by mutual consent" on September 1, Volkswagen announced on Friday. He'll be succeeded by Porsche CEO Oliver Blume, who'll retain his current position too. Diess had earlier reportedly clashed with Volkswagen's labour representatives over issues including top personnel decisions.

372.title: Agnipath recruitment exam for IAF conducted amid tight security
372.article_body: The Agnipath recruitment exam for the Indian Air Force began on Sunday in various cities across India, including Kanpur, Patna and Delhi, amid tight security. Police personnel along with Air Force personnel were deployed across various examination centres. Constant surveillance of examination centres was also carried out. The exam will be conducted from July 24 to July 31.

373.title: Was not called for 'Baahubali 2', don't want to question it at all: Sudeep
373.article_body: Kiccha Sudeep, who was a part of 'Baahubali: The Beginning', said he was "not called" to reprise his role in the sequel 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'. "I don't want to question it at all," he added. "I don't think...I missed being in...second part," said Sudeep, who played the role of Aslaam Khan, an Arabian weapon dealer in the first part.

374.title: Dil se shukriya: Vicky Kaushal celebrates 7 years of 'Masaan'
374.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post on the seventh anniversary of his film 'Masaan'. Sharing a few stills from the film, he wrote, "7 saal ho gaye! Dil se shukriya. #Masaan (It's been seven years. A heartfelt gratitude)." Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, 'Masaan' also featured Richa Chadha, Sanjay Mishra and Pankaj Tripathi.

375.title: My character in 'Liger' stammers, I struggled for first 3 days: Vijay
375.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said his character in 'Liger' has a stammering problem which according to him, made it more interesting. "It added both subtle humour and an emotional layer to [my] character...when we started shooting, I was struggling to get the right note, but after three days, everything was easy," he added. Ananya Panday also features in the film.

376.title: Krunal Pandya, wife Pankhuri blessed with a baby boy, share pics
376.article_body: Cricketer Krunal Pandya and his wife Pankhuri have been blessed with a baby boy. The duo took to their Instagram accounts to share pictures with their first child. They have named their baby boy 'Kavir Krunal Pandya'. Krunal's brother Hardik reacted to Krunal's post by sharing heart emojis. Several other cricketers, including KL Rahul, congratulated the couple.

377.title: Nathan Lyon marries real estate agent Emma after 5 years of dating, shares pic
377.article_body: Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon tied the knot with real estate agent Emma McCarthy after five years of dating. Sharing a picture on Instagram, he wrote, "Mr & Mrs." Several cricketers, including Brett Lee, Peter Siddle and Alex Carey, congratulated the couple. In December 2020, the couple had bought their first house together worth $2.6 million in Tennyson Point.

378.title: Woman gives birth on road after being hit by truck in UP, dies minutes later
378.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman gave birth to her daughter on a road after being hit by a truck in UP's Agra but died soon after. The incident occurred on Wednesday (July 20) when the woman's husband lost control of the motorbike they were on. The 26-year-old victim went into labour and delivered a healthy baby girl, minutes before succumbing.

379.title: 26-year-old kabaddi player bludgeoned to death with cricket stump in Mumbai; 3 arrested
379.article_body: A 26-year-old kabaddi player was bludgeoned to death with a cricket stump on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday in Mumbai's Dharavi, reported ANI. Three accused have been arrested in the case so far. Meanwhile, a group of locals gathered outside the Dharavi Police Station on Sunday to demand the arrest of all the accused in the murder case.

380.title: No need to panic, situation under control: CM as Delhi reports 1st monkeypox case
380.article_body: As Delhi reported its first case of monkeypox infection, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said there is no need to panic and the situation is under control. "We have made a separate isolation ward at LNJP. Our best team is on the case to prevent the spread and protect Delhiites," he said. The 31-year-old patient has no history of foreign travel.

381.title: Aditya cast me in 'Uri...' when I was being typecast by B'wood: Yami
381.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has revealed that her husband and filmmaker Aditya Dhar had cast her in a different role in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' when she was offered certain types of roles. "That same year (2019), 'Bala' happened. So he's someone who has a mind like that and he will never go the cliche way," she said speaking about Aditya.

382.title: Selectors will be tempted to have Dhawan in Team India till 2023 WC: Rajkumar
382.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said selectors will be 100% tempted to have Shikhar Dhawan in the Indian team till 2023 World Cup at least. "He has exceptional stats in white-ball cricket, especially if you see his record in ODI cricket, it's extremely fantastic," he added. Dhawan scored 97 in India's three-run win against West Indies in first ODI.

383.title: Tamil Nadu most 'atrocity prone' state for Dalits and STs: Govt data
383.article_body: Tamil Nadu has been identified as the state where most Dalits and Scheduled Tribes (STs) are subjected to various kinds of violence, according to Ministry of Home Affairs' data. As many as 345 villages in 37 districts of Tamil Nadu have been identified as 'atrocity prone', the data stated. In Chhattisgarh 101 villages are 'atrocity prone', as per the data.

384.title: Entrance tests for Class 10, 12 in Delhi govt schools to be held on July 25
384.article_body: Entrance tests for seats in Class 10 and 12 in Delhi's government schools will be conducted on Monday (July 25) and the results will be declared on July 27, officials said. Students who secure 33% in the test in each individual subject as well as in aggregate will be declared to have passed the entrance exam, the officials added.

385.title: Pune Police hold workshop on child sexual abuse; 900 schools participate
385.article_body: The Pune Police organised a sensitisation workshop on topics related to the sexual abuse of children. The online workshop, which was organised in association with other government and non-government bodies, discussed provisions of the POCSO Act and the concept of 'good touch-bad touch'. Notably, staff of around 900 various schools from Pune and surrounding areas participated in the workshop.

386.title: Pune woman robbed of ₹21 lakh by men posing as Aadhaar delivery agents
386.article_body: A woman was robbed of valuables worth ₹21.25 lakh at her residence by two men posing as Aadhaar card delivery agents in Pune on Saturday. The woman, who lives in the Somwar Peth area, was approached by the men at 11 am. She was reportedly home alone when the duo barged in and threatened her at knifepoint, police said.

387.title: Special tri-weekly train to run between Mangaluru, B'luru from Jul 26
387.article_body: An express train will be operated between Bengaluru and Mangaluru from July 26 onwards in view of disrupted road connectivity between the two cities. The train will depart from Bengaluru on Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday and from Mangaluru on Monday, Wednesday and Friday till August 31. It'll include two and three Tier AC, second class sleeper and general class seats.

388.title: CWG 2022 very important for us, we’re playing for a medal: Harmanpreet Kaur
388.article_body: India Women's captain Harmanpreet Kaur has said that Commonwealth Games 2022, where Women's cricket is making its debut, is very important for the team. Kaur added she has "grown up" watching multi-sporting events and she's already excited to walk with the rest of the contingent at the opening ceremony. India will face Australia in their opening game on July 29.

389.title: Govt believes scientific knowledge can be met by gazing at sky: Chidambaram
389.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticised the BJP-led Centre for raising the GST on scientific equipment needed by research institutions and universities "from 5% to 12-18%". "The government perhaps believes that all the scientific knowledge that we need can be gathered by gazing at the sky and re-imagining our past," Chidambaram said.

390.title: 2 Bengaluru policemen among 3 killed as car hits divider in Andhra
390.article_body: Three people, including two Bengaluru police personnel who were in Andhra Pradesh in connection with a drug case, were killed after their car hit a divider on Sunday, police said. The victims were identified as Sub-Inspector Avinash, Constable Anil Mulik and the car driver. Two more policemen, who were in the car, were injured in the accident.

391.title: Having Pak girl at centre was unique, I was excited: Farhan on Ms Marvel
391.article_body: Farhan Akhtar, who was seen in 'Ms Marvel', said in an interview that we've to be grateful for the push for diversity that's happening with storytelling in the West. "And that's what I...loved about Ms Marvel. To imagine Marvel would be making a series with...Pakistani Muslim girl at...centre is very unique...and I was excited to be...part of it," he added.

392.title: Chandni Chowk, Majnu ka Tila to be developed as food hubs: Kejriwal
392.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said Chandni Chowk and Majnu ka Tila will be developed as food hubs under the first phase of Delhi government's project to popularise Delhi as the food capital. The development would entail improvement of infrastructure and food safety norms. "Based on the learnings from these, we will develop other areas," Kejriwal added.

393.title: Ranbir-starrer Shamshera's shows cancelled in some cities over absence of audience: Reports
393.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, Sanjay Dutt and Vaani Kapoor-starrer Shamshera's shows were cancelled in several cities due to absence of audience, as per reports. The film earned ₹10.25 crore on the first day of its release on July 22. The film has been made at a budget of ₹150 crore, as per reports.

394.title: Traffic constable finds ₹45 lakh on road in Chhattisgarh, hands it over to police
394.article_body: A traffic policeman in Chhattisgarh's Raipur handed over a bag containing ₹45 lakh in cash at a police station after he found it on the road, an official said. Constable Nilamber Sinha found the cash comprising ₹2000 and ₹500 notes while on duty in the Mana police station limits area. A reward has been announced for him, said the official.

395.title: He came & conquered, again: Anupam Kher on Neeraj winning Worlds silver
395.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher congratulated athlete Neeraj Chopra for winning a silver medal in the men's javelin event at the World Athletics Championships 2022. Sharing Neeraj's throw on Twitter, Anupam wrote, "He came...We watched...He conquered...AGAIN!" Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories and congratulated Neeraj. She wrote, "The unstoppable Neeraj Chopra, pride of India."

396.title: Youth’s future in danger with new experiment in PM’s laboratory: Rahul on Agnipath
396.article_body: Commenting on the Agnipath scheme, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said youth's future is in danger. He tweeted, "60,000 soldiers retire every year, out of which only 3,000 are getting government jobs. What will be the future of thousands of Agniveers retiring after four-year contract? With this new experiment in PM’s laboratory, security of country and youth’s future are in danger."

397.title: My struggle was so much, I even thought of dying by suicide: Mithun Chakraborty
397.article_body: Talking about the most difficult phase of his career, actor Mithun Chakraborty said, "Everyone goes through struggles, but mine was so much. Sometimes I used to think I won't be able to achieve my goals." He added, "I even thought of dying by suicide. I couldn't even return to Kolkata due to some reasons."

398.title: Powerful laser that can be used to 'draw in the air' created by Chinese scientists
398.article_body: Scientists from China claim to have developed a device that can be used to "draw in the air without using paper and ink". The device uses ultra-short laser pulses to strip electrons off air molecules and turn them into light. In a demonstration, the scientists created characters using the laser which were visible from any angle and could be "touched".

399.title: Prostitution racket run by foreigners in South Delhi busted; 5 arrested, 10 women rescued
399.article_body: Delhi Police have busted a prostitution racket in South Delhi's Malviya Nagar area run by foreigners and arrested five people including a couple named Jumayeva Aziza and Meredob Ahmed from Turkmenistan and an Uzbek national. The accused used to lure foreign women to work in India and got them involved in prostitution, officials said. Delhi Police rescued 10 women.

400.title: Chiranjeevi Sarja's grandmother passes away, wife Meghana pens note
400.article_body: Actor Arjun Sarja's mother Lakshmi Devi, who was also the grandmother of late actor Chiranjeevi Sarja, has passed away. Chiranjeevi's wife Meghana penned a note remembering Lakshmi on Instagram, and wrote, "Ajji and I've had beautiful relationship." "We'd agreed to disagree on most things except for Chiru...when it came to him we'd think of nothing...but only the best," Meghana added.

401.title: I am broader than my contemporaries: Arjun on being body-shamed
401.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor, speaking about being body-shamed, has said he doesn't see enough "people respecting people" for accepting the way they look. "I'm physically not exactly up to what Indian standards of a man should be...because I'm broader than most other contemporaries...or...because I...put on a bit of weight in the process of it," he stated.
